title: Home In Good Shape With Partial View Of St. Clair River
comments: Formerly #4308. Sold in first round and now being offered for a discount. Recently Vacated. Taxes and Water bill have been paid. Home was heated and occupied throughout last winter. Has been cleaned inside and out and is now being sold in the 2nd round sale. Don't miss out on this opportunity. No liens. Same rules as normal auction lots. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Large Storage Building In Cadillac.
comments: One of the former light manufacturing buildings of the Mitchell Corporation, manufacturer of auto trim and interiors. Has an dual tractor trailer and a single box truck exterior loading dock. Two story office section and tens of thousands of square feet of open storage. This building has been stripped of much of its high amperage copper power wiring, but most of the panels, busways and conduit remain. The building is fully sprinklered for fire suppression, but there are heads removed in various locations indicating that it is in disrepair. It was heated with a large steam boiler, which remains but is in unknown condition. There are miles of steam lines and air compressor runs. The rear portion of the building is one story, and it appears it needs a new roof as there is pooled water in the largest warehouse room. It would require significant investment for this to become light manufacturing space again, and that may not pass muster with zoning. Its highest and best use is likely as cold storage or warehousing. We would suggest contact the local zoning officer to assure that your intended uses of the building are permissible.<p></p><p>PLEASE NOTE:</p><p>It is a REQUIREMENT of the office of the FIRE MARSHALL in the City of Cadillac, that the fire suppression (sprinkler) system in this building MUST BE IN OPERABLE CONDITION for any items to be stored in this building whatsoever. </p><p>The purchaser of this building will be required to post a $150,000 PERFORMANCE BOND in favor of the Wexford County Treasurer to assure that the fire suppression system is brought to operable condition; that roof repair or replacement is completed; and that the building pass local code enforcement inspections of all necessary types within 6 months of the sale.</p><p>Please contact the auction house or office of the County Treasurer for complete details on the performance bond to be furnished PRIOR to bidding. </p><p> Parties not furnishing evidence of commitment of a bond at the time of sale will not be issued a receipt or granted any right to enter for inspection. Any bond not executed and furnished within 20 days of the sale will be cause for a cancellation of the sale. </p> If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information. title: Handyman Special In Mancelona
comments: The left (north) portion is an older, small home. The right/south side was a two car detached garage. They have been joined and made into a residence. This one looks better in the pictures .... Will need a complete gutting and resurfacing and the economics of that should be investigated. Is on a crawlspace and some floors appear unlevel and/or weak. There is also considerable deflection in the roof. The mechanicals and fixtures are all pretty much going to need complete replacement. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Large Industrial Parcel In Mancelona.
comments: This parcel is located adjacent to rail sercice and US 31 in Mancelona. It is more than 13 acres in size. There have been several industrial businesses located here over the years, and some of them "left a little bit behind" in the form of groundwater contamination. There are a dozen or so green and yellow test well posts on the parcel. The parcels are also subject to a substantial special assessment which the purchaser will assume the balance due on. Sale includes two parcels. This is directly west of Palmer Park. A local business appears to be using some of the parcel to store its inventory .... this is temporary. A purchaser is strongly advised to obtain qualified environmental consultation BEFORE bidding on this one. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. Lakes of the North features golfing, a private air strip, campground, recreational activities and has a restaurant and tavern onsite. Please see the HOA website for full details ! If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Half Acre Parcel In Mancelona Township Off Darragh Road
comments: This parcel is roughly 115x135 in size, and sits 300' off the road, to the rear of the building at 9621 Darragh Road. It is accessed by a 20 foot wide strip that sits to the south (right) of that building. Level, dry, open lands. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Mobile Pad Near Mancelona
comments: This is a 2 acre +/- mobile home pad on a paved, county maintained road just outside of Mancelona. There is power and natural gas service to the parcel. We assume there is a well and septic here but cannot confirm their location or condition, if any. Small shed is in salvageable condition but weatherbeaten. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Lot In The Golf And Ski Community At Shanty Creek And Schuss Mountain Near Bellaire !
comments: This is a single family homesite in the golf and ski community at Shanty Creek/Schuss Mountain Resort just outside of Bellaire. There will be POA fees associated with the ownership, and this will entitle you to the use of the amenities of the project. Please see the SMPOA website for further details. The purchaser is bound by the restrictions of the plat, and assumes the POA fees as of April 1, 2015 as a condition of sale. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Site Condo At Hawks Eye !
comments: Hawks Eye is a newer, upscale gated golf community in Kearney Township near Bellaire. This development features a championship 18 hole golf course, clubhouse facility, swimming pool, tennis courts and much more. The purchaser shall be subject to the restrictions of the master deed, and assumes condo fees as of April 1, 2015. We have located a website for the golf course, but not the POA, so you will need to investigate as to the fees and deed restrictions here. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. You are not eligible to purchase this property for the lower "no reserve" amount offered at this second round sale. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Handyman Special At Ontonagon.
comments: Older home needs some TLC to bring back to life. There is evidence of a water leak and freeze damage in the bathroom and kitchen ceiling, and as a result the floors in the kitchen are VERY weak. Free trip to the crawlspace for anyone over about 150 lbs. The roof is very poor, but we didn't see any evidence of leaks inside. 3 teeny tiny bedrooms upstairs. title: Significant Historic Location At Painesdale. 9  Acres
comments: If walls could talk, this one could tell you the story of Copper Mining at Painesdale. This 9+ acre parcel is the warehouse for the Champion #4 mine, which sits across the street (not a part of this sale). There are two large, limestone buildings here, with the larger of the two being fairly ornate in design for a warehouse. The footprint of the two is roughly 150x60 (front) and 180x50 (rear). The two are connected and have several large overhead crane systems remaining from the "old days". The front building is very solid and shows little deterioration. The rear building is generally solid but could use some work on stone in places. The rear building has an addition to the far end that could be removed to bring the whole back to a unified appearance. There are two other metal buildings on the parcel, one is in poor condition. Neither are historically significant. The parcel is 9+ acres, much of which is a large slag pit and has no real functional use. There is roughly 4 acres of useful road-grade lands here. The site has 3 phase electrical service, however much of the wiring has been "harvested" for its copper value. We sold this property several years ago, and at that time it was fairly clean and secured. The present condition is quite messy. There are several thousand tires here as well as remnants of the last use, which was a metal scrapyard. The property is also subject to a lien by DEQ for past expenses in cleaning up contamination at the property. A purchaser will "inherit" this lien, which is well in excess of $150,000 as a part of the transaction. If you have sincerely interest in the details of this property, please consult with the Houghton County Treasurers office. This historic property has a TON of potential, but it will require deep pockets. title: Duplex In Bessemer !
comments: This one appears to have been built as a duplex. It was a modern, high quality structure for its time. The left/north unit is 2BR/1BA with a one car garage and is all on one floor. The right/south unit is 3BR/1BA. Both units have basement storage. We noticed a warped floor in the left unit, which is indicative of freeze damage and pipe rupture. The soffits of this house are in an advanced state of decay, and will need immediate repair. However we saw not indication that the roof itself is actually leaking. Electric, water and gas are all individually metered. This is still a really solid duplex in spite of exterior appearance. Well built and worthy of your investment or personal use. title: House With Great Curb Appeal. Verona Location.
comments: Verona. This is a stately mid-century home that in its day was quite the place. However it has developed a pretty serious issue with the foundation along the east wall and part of the north wall that, if not corrected soon, will be it's death warrant. The foundation is poured concrete, and it has deteriorated to the degree that there is a 1"+ wide crack that runs probably 40 feet. The east basement foundation wall has a noticeable deflection inward below ground level. The house has been mostly stripped and restoration was undertaken and then abandon. This one could be a real charmer, but it needs an owner committed to finishing the project. Has a nice new electric service, and municipal water. The roof is mid-age and does not appear to leak. The maple flooring has bucked in spots but could be salvaged in several rooms with little effort. comments: Older 2 story home currently laid out as a duplex. Appears to have been in this configuration for some time. The exterior is pretty solid, and it has a newer roof. The interior is worn and grubby. We found warped flooring in several rooms, which is a sign of moisture, typically from frozen plumbing and water accumulation in the basement. We found several freeze break issues in the plumbing, including damage to the boiler piping. We did not inspect the boiler itself in detail. Overall, this is a solid structure, but will need some rehabilitation, new subfloors, resurfacing and plumbing repair. comments: This one is pretty solid. Large 2 story home has had a mid-century modernization. The mechanicals are older and may need some upgrading. The roof is in pretty tough shape visually, but does not have any visible leaks indoors. Home is large, and cluttered with a lot of leftover rummage sale-grade junk. Easily a couple of 30 yard dumpsters worth or maybe more. There are some of the original architectural elements stored in the walkup third floor attic if you wanted to try a restoration to the original design. Basement is entered either via an exterior stair or a trap door, but is a Michigan storage cellar and not useful as living space. There is a large barn that is in really solid shape. title: Older, Low-Grade Home In Escanaba
comments: NOTE: This property is subject to a voluntary demolition order. The purchaser will be required to demolish the structure at its own cost within 6 months of the sale. Prior to deed delivery, the purchaser will be required to furnish a personal guarantee and $50,000 performance bond to assure this demolition. Please contact the Treasurers office or auction house for complete details. Older home on the northside of Escanaba. Last occupied about 2010. Sits on grade. The floors are bowing and weaving, and the roof does the same. The front porch roof has some advanced decay, and the entire house has some rot creeping up where the ground meets the walls. There is a one car attached garage that has a serious lean from similar issues as well as a 2 car garage on the alley which is in fair condition. Overall, this property would get a "poor" rating. Heat source has been removed. Water heater is disconnected and probably junk. Electric service is ancient and undersized.Lot is 40x125 with alley access. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Former Inverness Daily Building.
comments: This sale is for PART of the old Inverness daily store building. The main portion of the building sits on this parcel, but a small part of the addition to the west sits over the property line and is still owned (technically) by the former owner of the dairy business. None of the other buildings here are a part of this sale ... it's mostly this building and the parking area to the front. Septic system location is uncertain ... and the well may be shared also. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Former Cheboygan Co-Op Grain Elevator Building
comments: If you're looking for open, loft-type space, THIS IS IT. The former Cheboygan co-op grain elevator building is in generally solid condition. Most of the grain handling equipment remains, and the truck scale appears to be mostly intact as well. There are 2 floors with 10' ceilings that is solidly building in a traditional post and beam method. There is a substantial 3 phase electric service that is older but likely serviceable. The roof appears to have reasonably maintained, although there is a portion of the foundation along the north wall that is concerning. We could not view the basement because of standing water that exists because the power is off and the sump pumps are inoperable. (Welcome to Cheboygan). This building could make a fabulous flea market, artist cooperative or antique mall. Let your imagination loose on this one. It appears that the lot to the south is owned by the neighbor to the west, however we are offering the parcel across the street, in sale 6208, for additional storage or parking. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Commercial Building With Attached Residence Briley Township. Groundwater Contamination Issues
comments: Older gas station with attached residence and canopy. There has been a serious release of various contaminants into the groundwater from various underground tanks here in the past. The DNR is currently conducting a cleanup and may impose a lien for recovery of those costs, which could remain a lien on the interest of a purchaser. Site contains numerous groundwater cleansing apparatus and test/monitoring wells. A BEA (baseline environmental assessment) is STRONGLY ENCOURAGED to be obtained by a purchaser within 45 days of purchase. We have a letter from the DNR detailing the status of this property which you should obtain from us prior to bidding. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. The minimum bid includes all delinquent taxes, interest, penalties, and fees that were due on the property at the time of foreclosure. See MCL 211.78m(5) for more information.

title: Unfinished Phase Of Suttons Bay Condo Development.
comments: Sale 4929 includes 24 unbuilt condominium units in an uncompleted phase of the "Bay View" condo project at Suttons Bay. These units are assessed as having a market value of nearly $2M, and a quarterly condo fee assessment of $24,600 which the purchaser shall assume effective April 1, 2015. We call these "air condos" because many are second or third floor "units" in buildings that do not exist. These units are being sold in a single grouping and may not be reconveyed individually or in any grouping less than the entire unless and until the physical construction has been completed and occupancy permits issued by the local code enforcement officer. Any purchaser must furnish a performance bond in an amount equal to the cost of such completion, with the project to be completed in not less than 36 months from the date of conveyance by the Treasurers office. Failure to furnish a performance bond in a suitable amount will be sufficient cause for the seller to cancel the sale prior to the issuance of a deed as permitted by law. Please contact the auction house for the full requirements of the performance bond necessary to purchase this parcel. If you held an interest in this parcel prior to foreclosure and wish to buy it back, you are required by law to pay at least the minimum bid which was placed on the property during the first round auction. title: Single Family Site Condo Lot At Bay View Near Suttons Bay
comments: Bay View is a multiple unit and single family site condo development just north of Suttons Bay. The membership fees are $1025 per quarter and entitle the owner to use of the amenities of the association, which you should research in advance of bidding. This season we are offering 5 of the single family home site condo lots on the west side of M-22. Four of the lots (Units 7, 8, 9 and 10) front on M-22 and the fifth one (Unit 4) is situated between two existing homes a row back from the road. Please be sure you know which unit you are bidding on. This offering is for Unit 4. title: Ranch Style Home In Ludington !
comments: Perfect starter or retirement place in a quiet middle class Ludington neighborhood. This house is neat as a pin ... just like Grandmas house ! Slab on grade, block construction. We did notice some settling cracks in the NE corner of the house, but this is likely years old. 2 BR 1 BA and a laundry. One car detached garage. Lot is served by a rear alley and has all municipal utilities. This could be a real dollhouse. Older 60A fused electric service. Appears to have been vacant since 2011 or so. title: Restoration Project In Downtown Walkerville
comments: Prominent downtown Walkerville building. Has most recently been used as a tavern, but was likely originally a hotel property based upon the location of the stairway to the second floor. This one will take deep pockets to bring back to its true glory, but it is salvagable right now if someone gets to it quickly. Surprisingly, the roof (which does have leaks) appears to have generally been kept up over the years, and there is little serious structural rot with the exception of a few localized areas along the back 15 feet or so of the building. However it does need a new roof sooner rather than later presently. The largest issue here seems to be the exterior deterioration of the brick itself. The northeast corner, at the intersection, has visible signs of deflection that if not properly addressed could result in that corener of the building literally falling off. There are signs of delamination of the brick courses here, and there is extensive decay to the surface brick, especially over the rear wall of the building. There is a mansard type soffit over the upper floor of the rear ... god only knows what multitude of dins are hidden there. The main floor has been stripped of most of its historic character other than the stairwell to the second floor. That level was likely very small hotel rooms originally, but they have been stripped and joined together into larger suites. The second floor does not appear to have been fully used in decades. The entire building will need all new mechanicals. The plumbing is antiquated, and the wiring is hacked up and in unsafe condition and should be redone as well. The heating system is mid-century and likely junk. There is lots of debris here, and you'll be on a first name basis with the dumpster people. This could be a tremendous community asset in the right hands, but is not for the faint of heart or an undercapitalized dreamer. This is a serious project for a realistic investor. This sale does not include a liquor license. title: 3 Bedroom Modular House, 2 Car Garage, 2 Storage Buildings
comments: Strong pet odor in home. Will need lots of TLC to get back into shape.

title: Two Story Home On Small Lot ~0.05 Acres On S Wood St In Battle Creek. Vegetation Has Taken Over The Rear And Sides Of Home.
comments: Fenced in back yard. Small front porch. Looks like there is a centralized roof issue. chimney is crumbling slightly. Block foundation. House will need repairs. Possible leak damage inside. Home has an occupancy revocation notice. Will need to be brought back to code before it can be occupied again. Was unable to enter home do to over growth and multiple locks on door. Looks as though floor is peeling in main entrance of home. Mold visible inside. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding. This building contains evidence of mold. Mold is an indication of excess moisture which can come from a variety of sources including high ground water, improper sealing of foundation walls, damaged roofs, and other conditions which can be expensive to correct. Mold can pose significant health risks and, if extensive, may require a complete renovation which could exceed the value of the building. Please conduct your own research and bid accordingly. The property is condemned. First floor storefront with potential residence on second floor. On a main road through downtown Albion. Occupied storefronts on both sides. Street parking in front and large parking lot in rear. The upstairs is connected to the building next door through a doorway that has been left open. There is significant roof damage and flooding in the connected unit that doesn't appear to have affected this building. This parcel has been posted as "Condemned" by the local building authority. Properties are generally condemned when they are deemed substandard, unsafe, or otherwise unfit for use and habitation. Condemned property must be rehabilitated to meet local building codes prior to use or occupancy. A building is not automatically slated for demolition when condemned. However, this does not necessarily mean that demolition will not also be pursued by the local unit. Please check with the local building official before bidding to determine the specific status and requirements for this property. Large house, setup for use as 2 separate apartments. Across the street from Albion District Library. Between existing home and law office. Chimney and roof are in bad condition. Large amount of debris inside house. Gravel driveway with small area for parking in back. Slated for demolition. Contact Calhoun County Treasurer for more information. The structure(s) on this parcel have been slated for demolition by the local unit of government prior to sale. As such, it is being presented here as a vacant lot. You should confirm the status of this parcel as well as the allocation of the cost of demolition prior to bidding. The building on this property appears to have been used for multi-family occupancy in the past based upon indicators such as multiple mailboxes, entrances, numbering, layout, or other such factors. Modifications to the property may NOT have been legally made and may NOT conform to local zoning. Prospective bidders should verify with local officials that multi-family use is permitted under existing zoning. In many areas, once a multi-family use has been discontinued, it cannot be reinstated unless in conformance with local zoning and code. Lot is between two existing homes. The lot is sloped from the south to the north end. This parcel is located within a municipality which monitors property maintenance and condition. You may be assessed fees and fines if you fail to mow the grass or do not otherwise properly maintain the property after purchase. One advantage to these parcels is that they typically have infrastructure nearby (water, sewer, power). However, you should confirm the availability of such utilities as well as the connection costs prior to bidding. It is your responsibility to determine whether a parcel is suitable for your desired purpose. The house is located next to an open lot. Slated for demolition. Contact Calhoun County Treasurer for more information. House is between an existing home and a vacant lot. It has a stone foundation with some damage. The two chimneys are in poor condition. There is a grass driveway along side of house. Slated for demolition. Contact Calhoun County Treasurer for more information. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel. The main house is in poor condition. Stone foundation. Separate garage is falling apart with collapsed roof. Slated for demolition. Contact Calhoun County Treasurer for more information. One or more structures was boarded when we conducted our assessment of this parcel. Properties may be boarded for a variety of reasons. For example, properties are often boarded to prevent trespassers from harvesting copper plumbing, wiring, and other fixtures. Buildings may also be boarded by fire or other officials when they present a safety hazard. We generally do not enter boarded structures and limit our observations to the building's exterior. Likewise, you should limit any inspection of this property to its exterior only. You are not permitted to remove any boarding to view building interiors under any circumstances. Public property records or polite inquiries to neighbors may reveal additional information about a property's history. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. comments: Fenced in lot that is being used by residents next door. This property appears as if it may be a side-yard parcel. comments: The home is kind of back in the woods. The roof and foundation appear to be okay on the house. The roof on the garage appears to be in rough shape and falling in though. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. comments: Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. In these instances, there may be third parties that have the legal right to remove that mobile home from the parcel whether or not it has been assessed as part of the property in the past. We make no representations or warranties as to whether such mobile or modular homes are included with the real property offered for sale. It is the buyer’s responsibility to conduct their own research as to the state of title. As a preliminary step, it may be useful to determine if an Affidavit of Affixture of Manufactured Home has been executed and recorded as outlined in MCL 125.2330i. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney or title company to assist in this research.

title: Wooded Vacant Lot Near Hamlin Lake.
comments: 4 lot grouping on Sassafrass Road near Hamlin Lake. Level, dry, wooded lands.

title: Retail Storefront In Ludington !
comments: One story brick and block commercial storefront on the south end of the James Street retail corridor. Just a block from the waterfront ! Flat roof has some evidence of rot at the rear soffits, but we did not see any interior leakage from what we could see thru thru windows. Has onsite parking for close to a dozen cars, and a rear addition that holds potential to be occupied separately. Great location for your business !

title: 21 Foot Vacant Parcel In Downtown Ludington.
comments: 21' vacant parcel between two retail storefronts in the James Street commercial district of downtown Ludington. If you're considering this for construction, please verify that ability with the local zoning folks

This is a large older home that has been converted to commercial office use. It has multiple metering for water and electric at present. Holds excellent potential for conversion back to residential use as well as office type occupancy. There are several areas where the roof leaks, indicating that the entire thing is probably at the end of its useful life and should be replaced. The two car attached garage and basement are accessed by a stairway from the upper level (?) or an exterior door. Overall, the structure appears to be pretty solid, though the decor is a little bit dated. One block off the "main drag" in Ludington and a short walk to downtown and the beach. LOTS of potential for this one ... killer location in a great Lake Michigan waterfront community. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding.

title: Ranch Style Home In Ludington !
comments: Perfect starter or retirement place in a quiet middle class Ludington neighborhood. This house is neat as a pin ... just like Grandmas house ! Slab on grade, block construction. We did notice some settling cracks in the NE corner of the house, but this is likely years old. 2 BR 1 BA and a laundry. One car detached garage. Lot is served by a rear alley and has all municipal utilities. This could be a real dollhouse. Older 60A fused electric service. Appears to have been vacant since 2011 or so.

title: Vacant Parcel In Custer.
comments: Parcel is located on a dead end side street in Custer. Natural gas is available here.

title: 5 Acre Parcel With Homesite In Victory Township.
comments: 5.17 acre homesite in Victory Township, about 5 miles north of Ludington. The north and west property boundaries follow the course of a creekbed that is dry most of the year. It appears that there was a mobile or home here at one time that has been removed. There is still a storage shed here, and some debris to be removed ... but probably a weekend project at the most. Paved, county maintained road. Nicely wooded with an evergreen and poplar stand to the west side.

title: Pentwater Area Bluff Lot.

title: 33' Wide Strip At Lincoln Lake.
comments: This is a 33' wide strip of land that runs north from ther intersection of Arrow Road and Lendale Street to Lincoln Lake. May have been an access parcel for offwater parcels or could have other restrictions as a road or easement that should be investigated prior to bidding. This parcel is what we refer to as a 33'/66'. We frequently see foreclosed parcels that are either 33 or 66 feet wide. These parcels are often a result of existing or former road rights of way. A common road right of way is 66 feet wide. Half of that is 33 feet. There are two common scenarios that we see. Scenario 1: A land owner splits a tract of land and creates a common easement parcel for access. They might then quit paying taxes on the parcel with road frontage knowing that the easement would remain even after foreclosure. Such easements are generally either 33 or 66 feet wide. Scenario 2: Rural land generally runs to the center of any public road on which it fronts whereas subdivided land usually runs to the edge of the road right-of-way. Sometimes during surveys or other splits, half of the right-of-way (usually 33 feet) can become orphaned, effectively turning to no-man's-land. Potential bidders should be aware that 33 and 66 foot wide parcels are very likely to include easements. That means that there are people who have a right to use the property even though they do not own the land. It is unlawful to cut off access over a 33 or 66 foot parcel where an easement already exists. Even if an easement doesn't already exists, courts will frequently create such an easement to prevent a neighboring parcel from becoming landlocked. Potential bidders should consider that this parcel likely has little value and cannot be used to landlock a neighboring parcel when there is no other path for ingress and egress. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Historic Manistee Hotel Property. The Milwaukee House
comments: The Milwaukee House is a notable part of Manistees history. This property was carefully and meticulously rehabbed in the 1980's at a cost of hundreds of thousands of dollars. Sadly, it feel into an idle condition and suffered water damage from burst pipes several winters ago. Since then, many of the fixtures have been removed, and drywall, insulation, flooring and doors were stripped to allow analysis and repair. There are 3 100A electric panels, gas forced air heat, and central air to part of the property. The 7 guest rooms had individual environmental units, most of which are gone or in disrepair. There was substantial freeze damage to the plumbing that has not been repaired. The electrical and plumbing systems will need a general rehab prior to new wallboard going back up. Subfloors will need replacement, and some of the underlying structure is also weak in spots. There was a managers quarters in the basement, and a 2 car garage and side courtyard that was used in the past for light food service. NOTE: This building has very little offstreet parking, which will affect its use for overnight accomodation or any significant traffic. It also does not meet barrier free code at present and is not fire suppressed as may be required for lodging use. The property was used sporadically in the past as an Inn or bed-and-breakfast, but to our knowledge was never a profitable venture ... more a labor of love. The Milwaukee House awaits a new proprietor with deep pockets to put her back into her glory. It would also make a wonderful corporate retreat or home. This property contains physical indications that one or more water lines have frozen, ruptured, and leaked for a significant period of time prior to being shut off. Such indications can include damage to ceilings and floors and visibly damaged pipes and fixtures. Damage from freeze bursts can be substantial including significant harm to structural components such as framing and foundations. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

The interior of the home also shows evidence of an ongoing renovation project. There are 3 bedrooms and 1.5 baths in a rear wing. We noticed some weakness in the floor in the rear bedroom. We would anticipate there is freeze damage here. The entire place appears to have been neglected for some time. Last occupancy appears to be about 2013. Needs resurfacing (floor covering and wall treatment). The roof appears to be older but we did not see evidence of leaks. On a crawlspace. Electric baseboard heat. One car detached garage. You can see Portage Lake from the end of the driveway. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. title: Waterfront Building Site On Big Bear Creek !
comments: Sales 3013 and 3014 are adjacent WATERFRONT building sites in the Big Bear Estates site condominium, which is essentially a condo-subdivision. Each lot has frontage on Big Bear Creek in NE Manistee County, about 5 miles from Copemish ... and only 25 miles from Traverse City. Paved roads, underground utilities and beautiful scenery on a great fishing river. Year 'round greenery as the lots are mostly wooded in evergreens. Construction and use of the property is subject to the terms of the Master Deed, and the purchaser assumes liability for condo and association fees as of April 1, 2015. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Restoration Project In Downtown Walkerville
comments: Prominent downtown Walkerville building. Has most recently been used as a tavern, but was likely originally a hotel property based upon the location of the stairway to the second floor. This one will take deep pockets to bring back to its true glory, but it is salvagable right now if someone gets to it quickly. Surprisingly, the roof (which does have leaks) appears to have generally been kept up over the years, and there is little serious structural rot with the exception of a few localized areas along the back 15 feet or so of the building. However it does need a new roof sooner rather than later presently. The largest issue here seems to be the exterior deterioration of the brick itself. The northeast corner, at the intersection, has visible signs of deflection that if not properly addressed could result in that corener of the building literally falling off. There are signs of delamination of the brick courses here, and there is extensive decay to the surface brick, especially over the rear wall of the building. There is a mansard type soffit over the upper floor of the rear ... god only knows what multitude of dins are hidden there. The main floor has been stripped of most of its historic character other than the stairwell to the second floor. That level was likely very small hotel rooms originally, but they have been stripped and joined together into larger suites. The second floor does not appear to have been fully used in decades. The entire building will need all new mechanicals. The plumbing is antiquated, and the wiring is hacked up and in unsafe condition and should be redone as well. The heating system is mid-century and likely junk. There is lots of debris here, and you'll be on a first name basis with the dumpster people. This could be a tremendous community asset in the right hands, but is not for the faint of heart or an undercapitalized dreamer. This is a serious project for a realistic investor. This sale does not include a liquor license.

title: Vacant Parcel In New Era
comments: Home sized building site on Ray Street in New Era. Level, open dry lands.

title: Commercial Use Quonset Hut In New Era
comments: Commercial parcel adjacent to the pedestrian hiking and bike trail thru New Era. 40x 100 Quonset hut design. Natural gas. The front 3/4s of this building has been upgraded to retail and office space, and the rear portion remains warehouse with a small truck dock, and shop. There is a huge loft storage area that runs over the forward section of the building. We see some evidence of roof leaks in the ceiling tiles in the retail and office areas. This is a large, well built structure.

title: Large Vacant Corner Lot In Hesperia.
comments: A home has been demolished here. Large corner lot was titled in two, one-half undivided interests. Will be deeded as a single interest. Open, dry, level land in the village of Hesperia. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: Parking Lot In Downtown Hesperia
comments: Parking lot is across the street from the Hesperia Post Office and behind several businesses on the "main drag" in downtown Hesperia. Paved. In good condition.

title: Older Home In Need Of Tlc. Hart.
comments: This is an original finish, older home in Hart. The forward/original home appears to be generally solid, but has older mechanicals. There is an addition to the rear that contains the kitchen, and here the floors have noticeable sagging and there are signs of structural failure in the form of cracks and bowed elements. To the rear of this is an attached garage that has collapsed and needs to be removed. This one has potential with a cleanup and resurfacing. There is a good amount of rummage sale grade debris inside, but not much in the form of raw food garbage. There is some furnishing that may have value, but it is still the property of the former owner and they have the right to claim it. Roof appears to be quite old, but we did not see any evidence of leaks in the forward portions of the home. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. You should limit your inspection only to what can be safely observed from the building's exterior. Trespassers are subject to prosecution. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Commercial Storefront And Upper Residential Flat, Downtown Hart.
comments: Prominent corner across from the County building. Has been used as an insurance agency office for years. Has a front general trade area, one private office, and a 1/2 bath. Upper level has not been used as a residence in years and has original fixtures. Separate electric service to each floor. We did not find access to a basement, so we assume this is on a crawlspace. Roof seems good (no leaks). Steel sided. This building has *no* onsite parking, and relies entirely on public parking. That may restrict practical use of the upper level for residential purposes.

title: Handyman Special In Hart.
comments: Our one word description of this one is: Grubby. The house appears to be generally solid once you get past a layer of debris and grime. It appears the last occupant lived here without running water. It was difficult to assess the complete condition as the floors are pretty well covered with garbage. The mechanicals are older, but we did not see any major evidence of roof issues or other construction type issues. Located on a small sidestreet lot on the south saide of Hart. Has a lot of potential in the right hands. Pet and/or wild animal waste was observed within this property. Potential bidders should consider that urine stains/odors can be difficult to remove from porous surfaces such as wood floors or underlayment. This property is unsanitary and poses a potential health hazard because of raw food garbage, backed up sewer lines, or other similar waste. Such conditions can attract rodents, wild animals, and other vermin. You should bid accordingly and be prepared to mitigate the situation immediately upon purchase.

title: Rural Home On 5 Acres Near Horseshoe Lake.
comments: Modular home on a block foundation. In a remote rural location, with 5 acres near Horseshoe Lake. The home is still in pretty solid condition, but has been abused. It has a carpenter ant infestation visible at the front left corner. Roof has a leak at the right front corner. Will need a cleanout and a good resurfacing, but could be a great place. Parcel is 5 acres more or less, with 328 feet on McKinley Road. Runs about 650 feet deep. Lands are level, lightly wooded and dry.

title: Vacant Parcel Near New Era
comments: Single lot in the Tahoe Shores development, just south of New Era. Sale is subject to the deed restrictions and membership fees of the Tahoe Shores POA. Lot is left/west of 3164 W Tahoe Trail This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

comments: Single lot in Oceana Shores. Adjacent to the very nice riding, hiking and biking trail over the former railroad bed here.

title: Newer Single Wide In Oceana Shores
comments: Newer single wide in Oceana Shores. On a masonry block foundation. This is a solid, newer unit. There was a hole cut in the living room wall for a wood stove that has been removed. We are told that this unit was winterized before it was vacated, and that the last owner (deceased) took good care of the property before his demise. There may be some parties claiming ownership of this property under unrecorded documents .... but those interests are no longer valid.

title: Vacant Parcel At Oceana Shores
comments: Vacant single lot in the Oceana Shores development.

title: 6.5 Acres Near Rothbury
comments: Great development potential here. 6.5+ acres fronts about 350 feet on US 31 BR (Oceana Drive) and runs roughly 525 feet deep. It is described as three parcels of a little over 2 acres each. Nicely wooded, level, dry, buildable lands here. Surveys are likely of record at the county RofD office.

title: Hillside Lot Near The White River. Ferry.
comments: 1.27 acre parcel is on a south facing hillside covered in nice pines. Across the street from the White River in Ferry Township. Nice building site for a home.

title: 2.54 Acre Parcel Near The White River. Ferry.
comments: This is a long, narrow 2.5 acre parcel that fronts on both Johnson Road and E White River Road. It is immediately east of a large christmas tree farm planting, and the west boundary is fairly discernable. Parcel is wooded and rolling.

title: 5.45 Acre Parcel. Junkyard.
comments: Long narrow 5.45 acre parcel. Nicely wooded. Fronts 180 feet on 136th Avenue and runs 1320 feet deep more or less. There is a homebuilt shack toward the center of the property that is incomplete ... and probably should be torn down. There is also an "assortment of man stuff" all over the parcel. A couple pieces of machinery and trailers, but most of the rest of it is trash. You'll be cleaning this one up for a while. Nice property, but she has been used and abused.

title: Offroad 1.6 Acre Parcel. Ferry Township.
comments: Parcel sits several hundred feet off the nearest improved road. There are some two track roads into this area, but they cross other private lands and we are unclear as to the location of legal access, if there is any. Irregular in shape, but about 1.6 acres in size. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: 6  Acre Parcel In Shelby Township.
comments: Gently rolling six acre parcel. Lightly wooded in a mix of varieties. Runs 267' along 102nd Avenue, and is about 980 feet deep. Paved, county maintained road.

title: 1 Acre Parcel Offroad. Leavitt Township.
comments: This parcel is irregular in shape, but about one acre in size. It has no frontage on any improved public road. It appears that it is probably accessed through the former owners adjacent lands at 6767 E Fillmore, which lies west of this parcel. title: 9  Acres On The Pere Marquette River !
comments: 188th to Hogan. Follow to the tee and turn left (north) and then right onto Anne Drive. Parcel is roughly 518x1709 = 9+ acres. Much of this parcel appears to be low and marshy, but there may well be highlands here that we did not see on foot. Great river for canoe and fishing activity. Seasonal roads. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding.

title: Mobile Pad In Crystal Township.
comments: One acre parcel in Crystal Township. On a quiet rural road. Contains a mobile home setup with power drop and an interesting and unusual cellar/well pit. Parcel is roughly 330' along the road and 132' deep. This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose.

title: 5.5 Acre Farmstead Near Crystal Valley
comments: Parcel lies just NE of Crystal Valley village. There is a large home and several outbuildings located here. It is presently the location of a home operated business and is OCCUPIED. We did not have the opportunity to view the property in detail. It is our understanding that the former owner will be at the sale to buy the property back. This property is occupied. comments: Pythian Park is a plat that was never fully developed. Many of the "roads" shown on the plat map were never improved. This parcel has no improved road access. Level, dry, wooded lands. This property appears to part of a plat which was established before modern zoning ordinances where in effect and may include lots which are not large enough to build on based upon modern requirements. Interested parties should contact the local land use office for additional information and conduct other appropriate research prior to bidding to ensure that this parcel is suitable for your intended purposes. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

The rear becomes brushy and wooded, and there is a vein of marshland along the west border. Contains a roofover mobile home that is currently OCCUPIED. In typical condition for an older mobile. title: 5 Acre Maple Grove. Near Beulah
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape and sits about 1/4 mile north of US 31 on a quiet, gravel county road. The parcel runs east from State Road along the bottom of a valley which is wooded in towering middle aged maples and a few other varieties. The sides of the parcel roll downward toward the center, which is dry.

title: Mobile Home On A City Lot In Elberta. Walk To Betsie Lake !
comments: Trashed 1960's era mobile, with 2 additions, on a city lot in Elberta. There are holes and weak spots in the floor and it appears it may be inhabited by raccoons. Can it be put back together ? Perhaps, but it may make more economic sense to start from scratch. The value here is in the land. This parcel is literally just a couple hundred feet from Lake Betsie. Municipal utility service and natural gas here. Village of Elberta. DISCLOSURE: The last owner died inside this building of natural causes.

title: Handyman Special In Beulah. Almost 5 Acres Near Crystal Lake ...
comments: Older 1.5 story home with attached 2 car garage in Beulah. This parcel is nearly 5 acres in size, and rolls steeply downhill to the north toward Crystal Lake. The home is generally sound, but there are some apparent issues with the foundation wall at the NE corner which can be seen from an exterior walkaround. Has a walkout basement with some evidence of dampness. Yard appears to be low and may contribute to the settling of the foundation. Inside the house is grubby, but worthy of rehabilitation. Has a newer roof, furnace and water heater. There is natural gas and municipal utility service here. The garage roof needs replacement. The entire place would be well served by new siding and some decor upgrades. 3BR/1BA. Needs a good cleaning. Newer 100A electric service. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. Correcting foundation issues can be very expensive and issues are often more complex than they initially appear. You should research this issue thoroughly prior to bidding on this parcel.

title: Waterfront Site Condo Lot. Wiltz Lake Near Lake Ann.
comments: This is the second unit on the right (west) after entering Pearl Lake Estates. There is a home being built on the first lot, and the line in between is marked at the corners. The topography here may be a challenge, as there is embankment perhaps 15 feet high at the road to engineer around for a driveway. The waterfront here is "fishing lake" and not "bathing beach" type. Wiltz Lake is a smaller lake than has perhaps a dozen homes with access at present. Construction here is subject to the conditions of the master deed, and the purchaser assumes liability for condo association and other fees effective April 1, 2015. This is a newer development of upscale homes. This unit also comes with a space for a storage outbuilding in a community area to the south. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Building Site In The Lake Ann Area
comments: Lot is in the Sanford Lake No 2 plat. Slighty rolling toward the rear of the lot. Wooded and buildable from all visual indicators.

These units are assessed as having a market value of nearly $2M, and a quarterly condo fee assessment of $24,600 which the purchaser shall assume effective April 1, 2015. We call these "air condos" because many are second or third floor "units" in buildings that do not exist. These units are being sold in a single grouping and may not be reconveyed individually or in any grouping less than the entire unless and until the physical construction has been completed and occupancy permits issued by the local code enforcement officer. Any purchaser must furnish a performance bond in an amount equal to the cost of such completion, with the project to be completed in not less than 36 months from the date of conveyance by the Treasurers office. Failure to furnish a performance bond in a suitable amount will be sufficient cause for the seller to cancel the sale prior to the issuance of a deed as permitted by law. Please contact the auction house for the full requirements of the performance bond necessary to purchase this parcel. Owners are required to be part of the applicable condominium association (COA) which includes rules and regulations related to the use and ownership of each unit. Additional restrictions will be spelled out in the development's master deed. Condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Some condominium units delegate things like exterior maintenance and repair to the COA whereas the owner remains responsible for the unit's interior. However, there are many varieties of condominiums including residential and commercial interior space, condo subdivision lots, condo boat slips, condo campsites and others. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: 165X258 Parcel With Small Barn On Lincoln Road Near Solon.
comments: We did not view this parcel in detail as it appears to still be occupied (or in use anyway ...) Barn on property is about 25x40 and has electric service. There is a newer well on the property. Fronts on a paved county maintained road. Nice level open site. Just shy of one full acre. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: 8  Acre Parcel On M-22 At Omena
comments: This sale includes two parcels which total approximately 8.86 acres. There is a small stream which flows along the south boundary of the parcel. There has been some DEQ permitted work done along the stream in the past few years under Permit #13-45-0075-P, but it was done by MDOT and does not impact ownership of this property. The parcels from about 600 feet on the east side of M-22. The north line is about 725 feet and the south line about 475 feet deep from the road. This is very nice, level dry property that is partly wooded. There is a newer apron paved in from the intersection and a private road which bisects the parcel and also serves other parcels to the east.

title: Cottonwood Condo Unit At Timberlee !
comments: The SunPerch and Cottonwood condos at Timberlee date from the 1960's and 70's. This is a 2BR/1.5BA townhouse style unit with a 1 car garage in Building A at Cottonwood. The units all show signs of exterior maintenance being deferred. The inetrior of the unit needs resurfacing and general updating. This is electric heat. Modest galley kitchen and main level laundry. Was occupied until this spring. Purchaser will assume the association fees as of April 1, 2015. Subject to the condo master deed and other restrictions of the association. This lot is part of a condominium development. A condominium is a form of land ownership which is divided up into individual "units." Owners are required to be part of the applicable condominium association (COA) which includes rules and regulations related to the use and ownership of each unit. Additional restrictions will be spelled out in the development's master deed. Condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Some condominium units delegate things like exterior maintenance and repair to the COA whereas the owner remains responsible for the unit's interior. However, there are many varieties of condominiums including residential and commercial interior space, condo subdivision lots, condo boat slips, condo campsites and others. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed, COA rules and regulations, and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Building Site At Sugarloaf !
comments: This is a vacant building parcel at the Scenic Mountain View Estates plat located about a half mile north of Sugarloaf. Sits beloe road grade. Perfect for a walkout basement design. Paved, county maintained road not far from Lake Michigan, Little Traverse Lake and Sleeping Bear !

title: Excess Parcel In A Condo Development. Traverse City.
comments: This is a small, irregularly shaped parcel that lies adjacent to the Forest Park condo project near 14th and Division. It may very well be restricted as to development or use by deed restriction or other regulation. Please see the Master Deed at 2004C-00066 of Grand Traverse County records. Parcel appears to have no public road access.

title: Residential Building Site In Summit City !
comments: Parcel is irregular in shape but rough 120x124 in size. Level, dry, mostly open lands. NW corner of the intersection of Tillotson and Factory Street in Summit City.

title: Nice Residential Homesite On "radio Hill", West Of Traverse City.
comments: This is a full ONE ACRE residential homesite in a newer, deed restricted development off Harris and Cedar Run Road. It is atop "radio hill" west of Traverse City. According to price sheets for the unsold lots here, this one sold for $42,500 in the past. There are now 3 lots available here for about $30,000 and another with a well for about $40,000. Nicer homes, quiet area.

title: Commercial, Industrial Or Storage Building Near Traverse City.
comments: TENANT OCCUPIED BUSINESS. Property is located off Blue Star Drive, which is just off US 31 at the top of McRae Hill south of Traverse City. Has been used as a paint and body shop facility for several years, but may hold other uses as well. There is a high bay building that is roughly 50x40 in size, a lower roofed shop building that is roughly 80x30 and a small office area. There is a "discussion" taking place about title to the paint booth and other fixtures here. At the writing of this description, that discussion is unresolved. Please verify the condition of this property at the time of sale to update these comments. This is not a retail location, as it is a little tucked away in the corner of an industrial subdivision. It has many other uses. Because of its past uses, we expect it will need a good cleaning. The purchaser may wish to obtain a baseline environmental assessment before or at the time of purchase. A visual inspection of this parcel indicates potential environmental contamination. Visual indicators can include things like used tires, dirty soils, or chemically intensive former uses such as dry cleaning. Prospective bidders should carefully research the condition of this property prior to bidding. You may with to contact the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality or other relevant state agencies for additional guidance. Purchasers are strongly advised to obtain a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA). Some basic information about BEA can be found here. All sales are made as/is where/is without any representations or warranties. It is the sole responsibility of the purchaser to identify and appropriately handle any environmental contamination that may exist. Please do all necessary research before the auction. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information.

title: 82.5' X 264' Parcel On 4 Mile Road. Traverse City !
comments: Parcel fronts 82.5' along the east side of 4 Mile Road, and runs 264 feet deep. Because the parcel is not surveyed, it is not possible for us to know the exact corners, but it *appears* that there is a culvert and driveway at the road leading in to it. Topographical maps indicate that this lot should be generally dry and rises in elevation toward the rear of the parcel. That being said, there is a creek that runs along the south edge of this area and it could reduce the available building area. Please check the attributes of this parcel closely prior to bidding with local records and/or a survey. Paved county road. Natural gas.

title: Very Nice Suburban Traverse City Site Condo Lot.
comments: Site condo lot in is a newer development off Rusch Road atop 4 Mile Hill. The lot lies below road grade and lends itself to a walkout lower level at the rear. Use of the parcel will be subject to the master deed restrictions and condo owner association fees of the development. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Site Condo Lot In Cedar Ridge Near Grawn.
comments: Nice, dry level building site in Cedar Ridge site condo near Grawn. Construction here must meet the requirements of the master deed, and the puchaser assumes obligation for condo association fees effective April 1, 2015. Natural gas here as well. title: Unimproved Site Condo Lot At Lochenheath.
comments: Lochenheath is a high end, site condo golf community northeast of Traverse City. These parcels are in a phase of the condo development that has not yet been completed. There are no improved roads here, and utilities here may be stubbed, but are not extended to the individual lots permitting construction. Ownership and use is subject to both the restrictions of the master deed, as to condo association fees. The access in to this area has been barricaded. Tremendous bay views, but not much you can do here under current conditions. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

One story home in nice residential neighborhood in Saugatuck. Was unable to enter home without causing major damage to door/frame. Large amount of black mold visible through window. Vinyl siding looks good. Shingles on roof look to be in good shape but there is definitely some leaking occurring on back portion where the black mold is forming. Tree has fallen down in back yard and has caused some damage to detached one car garage. Dirt driveway. vegetation is growing over most of exterior of home. Large screened in porch on back of home. Wood floors. fire place. This house looks to be in good condition except for the black mold. Once that is taken care of this will be a very nice house. This building contains evidence of mold. Mold is an indication of excess moisture which can come from a variety of sources including high ground water, improper sealing of foundation walls, damaged roofs, and other conditions which can be expensive to correct. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding.

Lots of debris and garbage inside. Walls are collapsing. Floors are sinking. Was once set up as a duplex. Staircase on side of house. Gravel/dirt driveway leads to a very large detached one car garage. Furnace has been removed from basement. This property is unsanitary and poses a potential health hazard because of raw food garbage, backed up sewer lines, or other similar waste. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. comments: vacant lot. A few trees on property. Lots of mosquitoes. This property appears as if it may be a side-yard parcel. Frequently homes are located on one parcel and the associated back or side-yard is located on a separate adjacent parcel. These side-yards are sometimes foreclosed while the home is not. This can create unfortunate situations where fenced boundaries, septic tanks, out buildings, garages, and other improvements that were previously associated with the home next door are sold on their own. Such parcels may have value to the adjacent owners but often have little to no value on their own. You should investigate this parcel carefully and understand what you are purchasing before you bid.

The refrigeration equipment, including a large walk in and the bar coolers, are still installed. Many of the kitchen appliances are still in place. Customer bathrooms were functional. The second story located above the kitchen is unfinished but was used as a management office and a meeting space for employees. There is also a second bathroom on the upper floor. Most of the facility just needs to be cleaned and have debris removed. However, the roof is damaged above the office area and has been leaking down, through the floor, and into the kitchen below. There appears to be significant water damage in both areas. The basement was damp and had condensation on overhead pipes.
