title: Small Condo Lot Next To Pool In North Haven Village Condominium In South Haven. ~0.02 Acres
comments: Grassy vacant lot. Nice residential Neighborhood. Possible Association Fees. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding. title: Vacant Lot Partially Wooded Off M-60 In Cassopolis. ~0.53 Acres
comments: Partially grassy partially wooded lot. High traffic area. Trailer home with addition built on. Old foundation left behind from older building that is no longer there. Good place to put a barn. Surrounded by farm land.

title: Grassy Vacant Lot Of Barron Lake Rd. In Niles ~0.19 Acres.
comments: Mostly grassy lot with a few trees. In between vacant lot and a house. Nice quite spot to build. Small rusted storage shed in the rear portion of property.

title: Vacant Lot. Previous Home Was Demolished And Debris Has Been Removed. Near Barron Lake ~0.25 Acres
comments: Mostly dirt and grass yard with a few trees. Privacy fence surrounds the rear portion of the property.

title: Grassy Vacant Lot On Giles Rd. In Niles. ~0.24 Acres
comments: Mostly grassy. Farmland behind lot. Quite area. nice spot to build small home or storage garage. Some minor debris on rear portion of property.

title: One Story, One Bedroom, One Bathbroom Home Off Zilke Road In Niles. ~3.44 Acres.
comments: Nice large lot. The east portion of this property is Wooded. One story home on west portion. Both front and back porch. There is a walk in basement. The entrance is on the rear portion of house. Vinyl siding is in good shape. Roof showing no signs of damage. House is in overall fair condition. After a bit of cleaning this house would be move in ready. There is a large storage building behind home. There is a lot of debris in storage shed. Old tired and other miscellaneous items. Lots of area for storage.

title: Small Vacant Lot On Diamond Lake. Water Front. ~0.07 Acres
comments: Mostly grassy. Small lot in between two homes. Has a fire pit and a pile of brush/sticks. Large tree in front of property. This property appears as if it may be a side-yard parcel. Frequently homes are located on one parcel and the associated back or side-yard is located on a separate adjacent parcel. These side-yards are sometimes foreclosed while the home is not. This can create unfortunate situations where fenced boundaries, septic tanks, out buildings, garages, and other improvements that were previously associated with the home next door are sold on their own. Such parcels may have value to the adjacent owners but often have little to no value on their own. You should investigate this parcel carefully and understand what you are purchasing before you bid.

title: Large Vacant Lot Off Calvin Hill St. In Cassopolis. Partially Wooded Lot. ~35 Acres
comments: Lots of room to hunt. Good quite place to build.

title: One Story Home On The Corner Of Williamsville St And Carver Rd. In Cassopolis.  ~2.83 Acres
comments: Mostly wooded lot. Over grown vegetation. One Story home connected to a large two car garage. The garage doors are broken. Paved driveway runs from road to garage. There are major roof issues with this house. Ceiling has collapsed in a few rooms. There is a screened in mud room attached to the garage. Roof has collapsed in mud room. Hole in roof over garage. Block foundation looks ok. Lots of debris throughout property. Siding on home is falling off in certain areas. Siding needs to be replaced. Windows are broken. Large window in front of home has been broken and has oped the house to environment. Floors are sinking. House needs a lot of work or should be dozed and start fresh. Nice spot to build. Lots of trees. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding. One or more structures was boarded when we conducted our assessment of this parcel. Properties may be boarded for a variety of reasons. For example, properties are often boarded to prevent trespassers from harvesting copper plumbing, wiring, and other fixtures. Buildings may also be boarded by fire or other officials when they present a safety hazard. We generally do not enter boarded structures and limit our observations to the building's exterior. Likewise, you should limit any inspection of this property to its exterior only. You are not permitted to remove any boarding to view building interiors under any circumstances. Public property records or polite inquiries to neighbors may reveal additional information about a property's history.

title: ~6.57 Acres With Multiple Buildings Off Chain Lake St. In Cassopolis. Occupied
comments: Large lot that is mostly wooded. One story home on North portion of home. Roof looks to be in good shape. Block foundation and siding look sound. A lot of debris surrounds the home. Mobile home on South portion of property. Metal siding looks good. Large wood porch on front entrance. There are a few small storage sheds near the mobile home. Poured cement patio in front of home. Large two car garage in decent shape. Roof showing no major signs of damage. Siding could use a fresh coat of paint. There is also a small house/trailer near the mobile home that has seen better days. Tarps wrapped around it most likely dude to leaking. Roof needs work. Multiple buildings on this property. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Mid-Century Home In Calumet.
comments: Most of this homes on this street share a common roofline and style. This one has an attached 1.5 car garage and has had an addition to the rear as well. The interior is solid and straight and with a little cosmetic work could be sharp. The last folks liked the breaker panel and water heater so much that they took them along when they left ! There is natural gas available here, but this home is still on fuel oil (they left the furnace btw). Some hardwood floors. 2 small bedrooms upstairs. Some freeze damage noted. Bathrooms are kinda sorta tore up. This property contains physical indications that one or more water lines have frozen, ruptured, and leaked for a significant period of time prior to being shut off. Damage from freeze bursts can be substantial including significant harm to structural components such as framing and foundations. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

title: Waterfront ! On Manistique Lake Near Curtis !
comments: We are offering THREE, adjacent WATERFRONT lots on popular, all-sports, Manistique Lake near Curtis !<p> Buy one or all !</p><p> This parcel is not tax reverted land held by the County Treasurer, but instead is being sold for the Michigan Department of Natural Resources as excess lands. Funds derived from the sale of these lands are not used for general fund expenses, but are returned to the DNR Public Lands Trust fund to acquire other lands of higher benefit to the public.<p> Lot 113 is the westernmost of the three lots, and is trapezoidal in shape. It features 94.85 feet on the lake.</p><p> The lots are at the end of a 20' wide, platted road (Brown Trail), near its intersection with "Tralee Trail". This intersection is at the east boundary of lot 111 and Brown Trail has never been improved into the lots. A neighbor contends that the road ends here and the portion running westward has been formally vacated and no longer exists, however we have been unable to confirm that. So please investigate access prior to bidding.</p><p> 49 10 580 071 10 0.62 ACRES</p> The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. title: Great Rental Or Starter Home In Grayling
comments: Vacant 2 Bed, 1 Bath home. Open concept layout with cove moldings, new insulated vinyl windows, aluminum siding, and asphalt driveway. Great property for a starter home or rental.

title: Vacant Urban Lot.
comments: Building was recently removed. The structure(s) on this parcel have been slated for demolition by the local unit of government prior to sale. As such, it is being presented here as a vacant lot. You should confirm the status of this parcel as well as the allocation of the cost of demolition prior to bidding. This parcel is located within a municipality which monitors property maintenance and condition. You may be assessed fees and fines if you fail to mow the grass or do not otherwise properly maintain the property after purchase. One advantage to these parcels is that they typically have infrastructure nearby (water, sewer, power). However, you should confirm the availability of such utilities as well as the connection costs prior to bidding. It is your responsibility to determine whether a parcel is suitable for your desired purpose.

title: Great Downtown Store Front In Grayling
comments: Commercial Building (Former Radio Shack location). Property was built in the early 1900's. This building has a basement, rear entry and parking in the back. The local downtown district of Grayling has recently advanced its level within the Michigan Main Street Project. Adjacent park, block wall with bird mural and Radio Shack sign are not included with this property. Building Has a small 1/2 bath with hot water baseboard heat and on-demand water heater. There are cracks in the structural walls and basement walls. Front entrance may not be ADA Compliant.

title: The Lone Pine Restaurant
comments: Multiple buildings located on this Old 27/I75 Business Loop commercial property. The Lone Pine Restaurant, this parcel features a separate house and former sawmill building. With some improvements, this local eatery could be given a new lease on life. Interior photos are not available due to restaurant being occupied at time of auction posting. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information.

title: Livable Roof-Over Mobile Home
comments: Mobile home and garage located in the Mobile Estates Community outside of Grayling. Home looks to have been well-loved. 2 Bedroom, 2 Full Baths. Master bedroom has an on-suite bath. Seated on a large corner lot with mature flowering trees and two cement drive ways. Has a 2-car detached garage with automatic door opener, aluminum siding and windows. Roof on garage may require some repairs soon. This home features an open floor plan, with an open kitchen/living/dining space. Soacious kitchen with island and stylized cabinets and over the range hood. Separate sitting area to the back of the home and large covered deck. Newer forced-air furnace. Basketball hoop in front yard. Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. It is the buyer’s responsibility to conduct their own research as to the state of title. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney or title company to assist in this research.

title: Business Opportunity In Frederic
comments: Commercial building (former grocery store) in Frederic with roof-over mobile home on property. Large walk-in glass coolers, high ceilings with open floor plan, front office, newer electric, mixed plumbing in several locations, metal roof, some older existing water damage, back-loading storage area, and large air conditioners. Cement foundation pad and above-ground fuel tanks for the roof-over mobile home. The mobile home has an addition, but is in rough shape with a collapsed roof, 70's wood paneling, and no apparent furnace. This building contains evidence of mold. Mold is an indication of excess moisture which can come from a variety of sources including high ground water, improper sealing of foundation walls, damaged roofs, and other conditions which can be expensive to correct. Mold can pose significant health risks and, if extensive, may require a complete renovation which could exceed the value of the building. Please conduct your own research and bid accordingly. Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney or title company to assist in this research. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. title: Cottage With Great Peak-A-Boo Views Of Otsego Lake!!!!
comments: Decent View of the Lake from the Living Room and Front Bedroom. Well Kept Home. Looks to have been a three Bedroom converted into a 2 Bedroom, T111 Siding, Mossy Shingles, Vinyl insulated Double Pain Windows. Looks to have been Renovated well by a professional or skilled home-owner. Will need some updating, But all in all a pretty good House, in a Great Neighborhood. Midcentury Cabinetry, Some exposed Era Paneling, new 3 wire Electric and Breaker Box. If you're looking for an Up-North Cabin, or already have a Lake House and want a Guest House, This is your Opportunity This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Manuka Lake Waterfront Home Near Gaylord!(Possibly Handicap Accessible)
comments: Beautiful 3 bed 1 bath Home overlooking Lake Manuka near Gaylord. Entering the Home through Glass French Doors you are greeted with fantastic views of the Water! Proceeding Further past the kitchen, into the Living Room and Past the Stone Fireplace, out onto your Deck overlooking the Lake (Built with Low Maintenance White PVC decking) Under the Large Roof Overhang is the perfect spot for sitting out during a summer rain and sipping on a cup of coffee or glass of wine. Ramp style Walkway leeds down to the waterfront front concrete patio and fire pit. Large side yard, Water views from all 3 bedrooms, including the Master with on-suite bathroom. Master sits on opposite side of house from the other bedrooms, for added privacy. Insulated windows and doors, Large Mechanical room. Large Second Bathroom, Cement Driveway. Stylish 1/2 log siding with green asphalt shingles and white accents. Finish home to your liking on the inside, straight solid subfloors, sanded and white primed drywall waiting for paint, Kitchen plumbed and ready for cabinets. Some mold and water stains on Ceilings (Leak seems to have occurred at the peak of the roof) see photos. Home is ready to be finished to your personal style. (Home may possibly be handicap associable, Well styled low incline walkway to waterfront, Wide Doorways and halls, Large Bathrooms, Single story living.) All past installments of these assessments are included in the minimum bid price. The purchaser assumes liability for all future installments of these assessments. We would advise prospective bidders to investigate the balance due on all special assessments as well as the ongoing annual cost before bidding.

title: 15 Foot Wide Parcel. Mancelona.
comments: Parcel has no roadfrontage or legal access without going across other peoples land. 15 feet x 132 in size. Located directly behind 208 E Michigan St in Mancelona. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. These parcels are frequently too small to allow construction or any other practical use. They often have no road frontage or legal means of access. These parcels can often lead to adverse claims or encroachments by neighboring land owners which can be complicated legal issues to resolve. Please investigate this parcel thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Vacant Parcel In The Village Of Mancelona.
comments: East Michigan near Asbury Street in Mancelona. Dry, level, mostly open lands. This parcel is located within a municipality which monitors property maintenance and condition. You may be assessed fees and fines if you fail to mow the grass or do not otherwise properly maintain the property after purchase. One advantage to these parcels is that they typically have infrastructure nearby (water, sewer, power). However, you should confirm the availability of such utilities as well as the connection costs prior to bidding. It is your responsibility to determine whether a parcel is suitable for your desired purpose.

title: Mancelona Duplex Property
comments: Older home has been converted to a duplex. Has some roof issues "fixed" with the blue tarp repair method. 1.5 car detached garage needs some work. Power meters split. Inside, there is one bad area of roof leakthru, at the front wall dividing the two units. Some black mold has started, but could probably be rectified if someone addressed it promptly. The units are spartan, but fairly modern with upgraded power service and fixtures. Will need resurfacing and cleaning. On a crawlspace. It was winterized in December of 2011. We cannot guarantee that work with plastic pipes in December ... this was a bank repo. The building on this property appears to have been used for multi-family occupancy in the past based upon indicators such as multiple mailboxes, entrances, numbering, layout, or other such factors. Modifications to the property may NOT have been legally made and may NOT conform to local zoning. Prospective bidders should verify with local officials that multi-family use is permitted under existing zoning. In many areas, once a multi-family use has been discontinued, it cannot be reinstated unless in conformance with local zoning and code. One or more buildings on this parcel has a roof which is either leaking to the interior or appears close to failure. Failing roofs often indicate substantial structural decay inside the building. You should investigate the integrity of this structure(s) prior to bidding. There is evidence posted which indicates that a lender may be attempting to foreclose upon this parcel after such parcel was foreclosed for delinquent property taxes. A purchaser may encounter future contact from this lender. Tax foreclosure supersedes the rights of mortgage holders. If a mortgage holder does not foreclose upon their mortgage interest prior to tax foreclosure, their right to do so is generally lost. Typically such mortgage holders were provided all necessary notice of tax foreclosure but failed to act in a timely fashion to preserve their interest. In rare instances it may be necessary to cancel a sale if a deficiency in notice to such a lender is discovered. Please contact us or ask questions at the sale if you have concerns about this issue.

title: 3.5  Acres In Central Lake
comments: Parcel is approximately 3.61 acres. It has no direct public road frontage, but is accessed by a gullied two-track that runs off the end of Cameron Street in Central Lake. The road is nearly impassable from washouts, even with 4WD. It is a hillside, east facing parcel that is partly wooded with an opening on the east face. It is located west and north of the Grace Community Church property on South Main Street. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Small Marshland Parcel Near Torch Lake Village.
comments: There is standing water on this parcel, and it is unlikely to support construction. Might make an excellent tree stand location for an archer though ! This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

title: Small Lowlands Parcel Near Torch Lake Village.
comments: There is a platted road to this parcel that has long ago overgrown. There is a large tree felled across it which we assume someone did intentionally to keep folks out. There are swamplands in this area, and we did not walk in to the parcel. Generally level and wooded. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use.

title: Building Site In The Lakes Of The North.
comments: This is a vacant building lot in the Lakes of the North development, located between Mancelona and Gaylord. There is a HOA here, and the purchaser assumes responsibility for association fees that accrue after April 1, 2015. Lakes of the North features golfing, a private air strip, campground, recreational activities and has a restaurant and tavern onsite. Please see the HOA website for full details ! This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

There is a HOA here, and the purchaser assumes responsibility for association fees that accrue after April 1, 2015. Lakes of the North features golfing, a private air strip, campground, recreational activities and has a restaurant and tavern onsite. Please see the HOA website for full details ! This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: "long" Ten Acre Parcel South Of Mancelona.
comments: Parcel fronts 330' or so on the south side of Musser Road, which isn't much more than a 2 track here. 1325' feet deep to the south. Parcel is a valley bottom, and is wooded in mixed vegetation, mostly younger softwoods and brush. There is a power service here, and a primitive campsite. We do not have title to the trailer and it is NOT a part of the sale. "Bath with a path" and a seasonal road. The driveway in to the parcel is its approximate west boundary. We have maked the approximate location of the east line at the road with red marker tape. There is loose sand here. not a place to bring your Kia Rio unless you know someone with a tow truck. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

title: Half Acre Parcel In Mancelona Township Off Darragh Road
comments: This parcel is roughly 115x135 in size, and sits 300' off the road, to the rear of the building at 9621 Darragh Road. It is accessed by a 20 foot wide strip that sits to the south (right) of that building. Level, dry, open lands.

title: Newer Occupied Modular Home West Of Mancelona.
comments: This is a newer, well kept OCCUPIED modular home on a block crawlspace just west of Mancelona. We did not have the opportunity to view it in detail because of the occupancy. There is an older garage/outbuilding on the parcel as well. Just a little over 3 acre lot. There IS municipal water out here, but we presume this one is on a septic. If that is critical to you it should be verified. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. This property is occupied. Please respect the privacy of current occupants and limit any inspection to what can be safely observed from the road. Some occupants may be upset or angry and may meet contact with aggression or violence. Please use discretion and caution when researching this or other occupied properties. Furthermore, although this property has been foreclosed for unpaid taxes, occupants have certain rights under Michigan law and must be formally evicted if unwilling to leave voluntarily. You may wish to consult a licensed attorney for more information.

title: Mobile Pad Near Mancelona
comments: This is a 2 acre +/- mobile home pad on a paved, county maintained road just outside of Mancelona. There is power and natural gas service to the parcel. We assume there is a well and septic here but cannot confirm their location or condition, if any. Small shed is in salvageable condition but weatherbeaten. This parcel appears to include an area where a mobile home was previously located. Such mobile home pads will frequently include well/water and septic/sewer connections as well as power hookups. However, local zoning regulations may prohibit placing a new mobile home on this site despite the fact that one was previously located here. Please check local zoning regulations carefully prior to bidding. We make no representations or warranties as to the suitability of this parcel for any purpose.

title: Secluded Homesite On 10 Acres In A Very Rural Setting.
comments: This is a "long 10" on a quiet country road. We have marked the SE corner at the road with red marker tape. The gated driveway is the approximate west line of the parcel, and that drive runs all the way along the west line more or less, to the north boundary of the 10 acres. There is a cleared homesite that contains the remnants of a burned out home about 1/3rd of the way in to the parcel. The power service (underground) and newer 4" well appear to be serviceable, but not guaranteed. The woods to the rear is dense and younger. Mixed growth. DISCLAIMER: This property was the location of alleged sexual crimes for which the offender is now in prison. This could affect the resale value of this property. Bid accordingly. Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV. This parcel includes structures which have been damaged by fire. It is up to the auction purchaser to determine if this property can be restored to a safe condition and to comply with all relevant local regulations and building codes. Please research thoroughly prior to bidding.

title: Gravel Near Alba. 4.75 Acres !
comments: Sales 3132 and 3133 are adjoining parcels of just less than 5 acres each. They are accessed by what may be a private road (we noticed a gate) named Stewart Road. You may wish to investigate whether this is legal access for these parcels by record. Parcel 3132 sits east of 3133, off Stewart Road, on a two track that is unnamed. We have marked the approximate NW, and SW corners of 3133 along Stewart Road, and the approximate line between the two parcels and the SE corner of 3132 along the two track. Buy one or both ! There is a long standing gravel pit across the road, and both of these parcels exhibit evidence that there is a substantial gravel potential here as well.

title: Nicely Wooded 10 Acre Parcel In Mancelona Township.
comments: Here is another nice Antrim County "long ten". This located on Bocook Road in an area of active oil and gas development. There is a small camp cleared at the very NW corner of this parcel and there is a power service and two campers there. We cannot be certain if these are on the property or not without a survey, but they are very close to the property line. Remember that the campers are personal property ... we do not have title to them and they are not included in the sale even if they ARE on the property ... There is a trail that runs SE from the campsite which leads us to believe that they are, however. There is some oil &amp; gas production equipment on the east side of the property here as well. We have marked the approximate location of the SW corner of this parcel on Bocook Road, The approximate NW corner is at the roadway leading into the campsite. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.

comments: This is a single family homesite in the Swiss Village development just outside of Bellaire. There will be POA fees associated with the ownership, and this will entitle you to the use of the amenities of the project. Please see the SVEPOA website for further details. The purchaser is bound by the restrictions of the plat, and assumes the POA fees as of April 1, 2015 as a condition of sale. This parcel is likely subject to ASSOCIATION FEES which are assessed to cover maintenance and other costs associated with the development in which the parcel is located. Interested parties should verify the existence and extent of association fees and costs prior to bidding.

title: Site Condo At Hawks Eye !
comments: Hawks Eye is a newer, upscale gated golf community in Kearney Township near Bellaire. This development features a championship 18 hole golf course, clubhouse facility, swimming pool, tennis courts and much more. The purchaser shall be subject to the restrictions of the master deed, and assumes condo fees as of April 1, 2015. We have located a website for the golf course, but not the POA, so you will need to investigate as to the fees and deed restrictions here. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: 3  Acre Secluded Homesite
comments: Parcel is located in the Schuss Mountain/Swiss Village area. On a seasonal, private road. We do not see power here. There *might* be POA fees here, as it is reached via roads from the Swiss Village development. You will want to research that in advance of bidding. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding.

title: 40 Acre Parcel Off Gated Road. Jordan Township.
comments: This is a "square 40" that lies 5 parcels east of a gate on a private road. We did not have access to view it or determine whether that gated road actually reaches it ... and if it does, whether it provides legal access. USGS topo maps indicate that roughly 1/4 of this parcel may be wetlands. If you proceed to auction parcel 3121, the gate is at its east boundary. The mapping shows the private road after the gate ends BEFORE it gets to this parcel, but that is uncertain without actual inspection on the ground. CAREFUL: We are told that there is a property owner on this private road that is quite assertive about "strangers" not belonging there. We have been told that you may not want to encounter him without being forewarned. You have been so warned. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: Nice 10 Acre Parcel In Jordan Township.
comments: This is a "long 10" on a private road. The property rises uphill to the north from the road and is nicely wooded in a younger mix. There is an older trailer here that you should NOT assume "goes with" the property, as it is not not physically "attached". It's not skirted and the former owner may well come and get it if he wants to. There IS power service here. Road is not county maintained. We have marked the approximate SE and SW corners where they meet the road. There will be some debris to remove, but it's a pretty nice parcel once you get past that chore. CAREFUL: We are told that there is a property owner on this private road that is quite assertive about "strangers" not belonging there. We have been told that you may not want to encounter him without being forewarned. You have been so warned. This property MAY still be occupied and that party may be the one so noted. Just a FYI. Be safe out there ... Mobile homes (and some modular homes) can be separately titled and considered personal property. In these instances, there may be third parties that have the legal right to remove that mobile home from the parcel whether or not it has been assessed as part of the property in the past. We make no representations or warranties as to whether such mobile or modular homes are included with the real property offered for sale. title: 3 Acre Parcel With Older Trailer. Jordan Township.
comments: Parcel contains an older mobile with roofover. There is also an older frame structure that is collapsing that contains the well. It is an old 1.5 in shallow well. There is some history here of property line issues with neighboring parcels on both sides. The trailer still has its tongue, so you can haul it away if you wish to use the parcel for other things. Just shy of 3 acres. On M-66 in Jordan Township. This parcel includes a structure which should be considered DANGEROUS. This building has suffered structural damage which creates substantial risk of harm from falling through damaged areas or collapse from above. It may also contain extensive debris which could fall or collapse, rusty nails, broken glass, and other hazards. You are not permitted to enter this or any other structure offered at tax sale. title: Cabin "up North" On 5 Acres !
comments: This one is what LOTS of people ask us for ! A modern cabin in decent repair on small acreage in a great spot ! Newer vinyl sided unit is partly finished, but could probably support occupancy while finishing touches are being applied. Ceramic tile floor in kitchen. Newer 4" well. We did not see a heater, but we noticed a propane tank, There is a good 40 yard dumpster load of stuff to get rid of, but probably a weekend project at worst. Nicely wooded rolling 5 acre parcel. Extremely quiet neighbors across the street who will never have loud parties or borrow your mower and not bring it back. 333' on road. 622' deep The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: 1 Acre Parcel In Jordan Township.
comments: This is a 1 acre parcel off Old State Road. We were unable to locate any road access ... even off two track. The area is rolling and wooded. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress.

title: 23 Acres Just North Of Elk Rapids ... No Improved Road Access ... Primarily Marshlands.
comments: Parcels 3116 and 3117 have no public road access, but do have a recorded easement off Williams Road. The only improved access is through a gated drive (private). The lands next door, now under the control of the township, was previously a shooting range. This is primarily marshland according to USGS topographical maps ! The land may hold some potential as recreation property for nearby property owners that adjoin and have access rights. It would also make a wonderful mosquito farm. Almost 23 acres between the two parcels. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. comments: Older waterfront cabin on the west shore of Six Mile Lake. It appears that the property is still occupied, at least part time. It has a newer roof. This is located directly north of the Echo Township Park and boat launch on Six Mile Lake. The foundation of one or more buildings located on this parcel appears to be failing. title: .... And Another 10 Acres Right Next Door !
comments: Sales 3104 and 3105 are side-by-side 10+ acre parcels on Frog Hollow Road near Shanty Creek. Buy them both and enjoy a great 20 acres ! The front third of the parcels is open, and the rear rolling and wooded. Frog Hollow is a seasonal road. We have marked the NE and SE corners of the parcels as well as the point-between the two with red marker tape at their approximate locations. There is power in the area but not immediately at the road here. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding.

A condominium is a form of land ownership which is divided up into individual "units." Owners are required to be part of the applicable condominium association (COA) which includes rules and regulations related to the use and ownership of each unit. Additional restrictions will be spelled out in the development's master deed. Condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Some condominium units delegate things like exterior maintenance and repair to the COA whereas the owner remains responsible for the unit's interior. However, there are many varieties of condominiums including residential and commercial interior space, condo subdivision lots, condo boat slips, condo campsites and others. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed, COA rules and regulations, and investigate association fees prior to bidding. title: Cute Little Vertical Log Cabin Near The Mighty Mac !

title: Moldy House In Alanson.
comments: Late century tract housing unit in Alanson. House has mold from a bad roof and extended closure. There is noticeable decay in the eave edges. The interior has poor air quality and will require a complete gutting, sealing and resurfacing at a minimum. Nice level corner lot just NW of Alanson in an area of well kept homes. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior. This building contains evidence of mold. Mold is an indication of excess moisture which can come from a variety of sources including high ground water, improper sealing of foundation walls, damaged roofs, and other conditions which can be expensive to correct. Mold can pose significant health risks and, if extensive, may require a complete renovation which could exceed the value of the building. Please conduct your own research and bid accordingly.

title: Lake Michigan Waterfrontage !!!
comments: First the brass tacks: This parcel is not large enough to support construction under zoning requirements. That being said, many use these parcels for camping or recreation. The sunsets from here are amazing. This one could be yours! This property appears to part of a plat which was established before modern zoning ordinances where in effect and may include lots which are not large enough to build on based upon modern requirements. title: 16 Acres Near Larks Lake !
comments: Parcel fronts 549' feet or so along the east side of N Larks Lake Road and runs about 1320' deep. The front half of the parcel is open, and the rear is wooded in younger mixed varieties including evergreens, birch, poplar, and few maples and other hardwoods. County maintained paved road in a resort lake area.

title: 40 Acres Farm Property Near Bliss!
comments: There is a LOT of potential with this scenic rural farmstead in Bliss Township. The house is a "Biltmore" with an older front 1.5 story section and a more modern rear 2 story addition. It appears that someone was living here without utilities and/or running water. The entire place is rather overrun with garbage so it difficult to assess its exact condition. However it appears to be structurally solid with the exception of some apparent roof leaks in the front section of the house. There has been some vandalism and we would expect frozen pipes and some other issues from deferred maintenance. The garage needs help and has a lot of debris also. PLEASE NOTE: The pole barn to the east of the house and garage is NOT a part of this parcel. The property is irregular in shape and runs 1/2 mile deep. The front portion is mostly high and open with an older apple grove along the east line. Further back in is younger growth of mixed varieties. It would appear the this property has been timbered in the fairly recent past. We did not see any evidence of much in the way of substantial saw logs in the portion of the property we viewed.

title: Handyman Special In Boyne City.
comments: Someone started a major rehab and ran out of gas. Upper floor stairway has been removed, but it "looks" decent from down below. The floor joists in the rear have been removed to access plumbing which is partly redone. Roof looks newer. Has some potential for someone with the skills needed to finish it off. Nice corner lot in a nice family town. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Traingular Corner Lot At Pearsall Road
comments: Parcel fronts 379.5 or so on the west side of Pearsall Road south of the intersection with the EJ/BC Road. Triangular in shape. Mostly open, level dry lands.

title: 3  Acre Parcel On The Ej>Bc Road
comments: 330' frontage on the East Jordan-Boyne City road just east of EJ. Nice level, well drained building site.

title: 10 Acres. Mostyly Tillable. South Arm Township
comments: This is a "long ten" of mostly open lands on a paved county road. Nice rural area. We are selling three 10 acre parcels in the vicinity, being 1306, 1307 and 1308. Parcel has a woodlot to the rear.

title: 10 Acres With A New Modular Home. South Arm Township
comments: This is a "long ten" of mostly open lands on a paved county road. Nice rural area. We are selling three 10 acre parcels in the vicinity, being 1306, 1307 and 1308. Parcel has a woodlot to the rear. There is a newer modular home on the parcel that appears to be in very good condition. We did not inspect the interior because the power is still on and it appears to contain personal property that has not yet been removed. Be advised that neighbors are watching this property for the former owner. There is also a very nice storage buiding that is about 60x60 in size. 9.81 acres more or less. This parcel appears to contain "personal property" that may be of value. Property tax foreclosure affects only "real property." In general, real property includes the land and those things physically attached to it. This sale includes only such real property. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property. The interior of this property was not viewed during our inspection. Buildings which are dangerous, occupied, boarded, condemned, or otherwise difficult to enter are inspected from the exterior/curbside only. You are NOT authorized to enter these or any other buildings offered for sale. You should limit your inspection to that which can be made safely from the building's exterior.

title: 10 Acres Offroad Near East Jordan.
comments: This is a "long 10" near the tippy top of some steep terrain up behind the EJ Middle School. IF you can get to the intersection of where Mill Street and Hickock Road "would" meet, that's the spot ! Unfortunately there are no roads there and we're not certain of the legal access or easement if there is one (you should research this before bidding). Both roads into this area cross other peoples property and may not be legal. Wooded property with a real secluded setting. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding. This parcel does not front on a public or privately deeded improved road. Often times there are easements in the recorded chain-of-title that provide legal access to such parcels but other times there are not. You should thoroughly research this parcel's access rights prior to bidding. It can require expensive, complicated, and time consuming legal proceedings to secure legal access to landlocked parcels that do not have easements for ingress and egress. This parcel appears to have challenging terrain. Challenging terrain can include steep hillsides, ravines, gullies, or similar topographical features as well as little to no buildable area. Such parcels often have no practical use. You should investigate this parcel's terrain and suitability for your desired purpose prior to bidding.

title: Your Very Own Piece Of Loeb Creek
comments: This one is a "frequent flyer" with us, as we have sold it before. This parcel lies just across Evergreen Lane to the NW of the legendary "Castle Farms" Music Theatre. There are exclusive homes nearby in the Lake Charlevoix resort area. This particular parcel is bisected by Loew Creek, and a good portion of it is wetlands. It is uncertain whether there is enough dry land here to support construction. We'd recommend a survey to be sure of that as well as consultation with zoning folks and others. The assessor thinks it's worth over $100k ... what do you think ? Our review of this parcel indicates that the noted State Equalized Value (SEV) does not appear to reflect the current value of the property. This is often due to buildings or other improvements being demolished or fire damaged or other similar items included in the SEV being removed from the property. It can also be due to market changes in the area in which the property is located. It should be further noted that the SEV/assessed value of the parcel as noted in this listing may be several years old. You should consult a local real estate professional or appraiser to help you assess the current market value of this property before bidding and should not base your valuation on the stated SEV.

title: 10.26 Acre Parcel In Woodland Heights Estates
comments: This is a nice, high, dry wooded 10.26 acre parcel in a private association named "Woodland Heights Estates". There are POA association fees here that the buyer assumes as of April 1, 2015. There is a natural gas facility that straddles over the boundary of this parcel and the one to the west. The road in to that equipment is roughly the west line of our parcel. The campers and other thinsg are on the neighbors property, and not this one. There is a road into this parcel that has overgrown, and can be found just behind the sign we have posted. It runs from the center of the parcel in a big loop back to the area where the NG equipment is located. We're pretty sure that the mineral rights are NOT included with this property, so no Jed Clampett mailbox money for you. Nice wooded property in a recreational oasis. It's about 5 miles to Boyne Falls and 7 miles to Vanderbilt from here. Roads are private gravel roads. There are a few other houses near this parcel, so power isn't a big issue.

title: Vacant Lot In Bayshore !
comments: Parcel at one time had a house trailer that has been removed. There is a well and power service here. Was formerly owned by the neighbor to the west. Small shed on property may be removed. Just steps from Little Traverse Bay at Bayshore near the Emmet/Charlevoix County line.

title: Nice 2 Acre Parcel Near Lake Charlevoix !
comments: Parcel fronts 250' on Loomis Road and runs 350' deep to the south. Would make a great countryside homesite. Level, dry lands on a paved county road. Or if you prefer more privacy, there is a seasonal road on the west boundary that could be used to access the property. Parcel is wooded around the perimeter, and mostly open in the center.

title: Waterfront ! On Manistique Lake Near Curtis !
comments: We are offering THREE, adjacent WATERFRONT lots on popular, all-sports, Manistique Lake near Curtis !<p> Buy one or all !</p><p> This parcel is not tax reverted land held by the County Treasurer, but instead is being sold for the Michigan Department of Natural Resources as excess lands. Funds derived from the sale of these lands are not used for general fund expenses, but are returned to the DNR Public Lands Trust fund to acquire other lands of higher benefit to the public.<p> Lot 112 is the center of the three lots, and is rectangular in shape. It features 104.26 feet on the lake.</p><p> The lots are at the end of a 20' wide, platted road (Brown Trail), near its intersection with "Tralee Trail". This intersection is at the east boundary of lot 111 and Brown Trail has never been improved into the lots. A neighbor contends that the road ends here and the portion running westward has been formally vacated and no longer exists, however we have been unable to confirm that. So please investigate access prior to bidding.</p><p> 49 10 580 070 10 0.43 ACRES</p> The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. title: Older Home On The West Side Of The Soo.
comments: It's stinky, but solid. Older home has some hardwood floors. Updated mechanicals. Roof appears good for now. Was occupied until May. Basement is damp .. we'd keep the power on and sump pumps here if you will be absentee. Kitchen has raw food garbage and is ripe. Second floor stair was in accessible because of a 5' high pile of raw food garbage stacked on the back porch leading to stairs. Hold your nose and bring home a profit ! You'll be using a shovel to "flip" this one ! This property is unsanitary and poses a potential health hazard because of raw food garbage, backed up sewer lines, or other similar waste. Such conditions can attract rodents, wild animals, and other vermin. You should bid accordingly and be prepared to mitigate the situation immediately upon purchase.

comments: Parcel fronts 46.5' on the south side of Spruce Street. Runs 156 feet deep. Densely wooded. There is a curb cut and municipal utilities and natural gas at the curb.

comments: Parcel sits slightly below road grade and exhibits some signs of being "moist". Off of Ashmun Street 38' wide and 125' deep. Across the street from the Hydro Spray car wash. This parcel is too small to be practically useful under most circumstances. Many times such parcels are the result of survey or property transfer errors which create small orphaned slivers of land. title: Large Historic Home In Sault Ste Marie.
comments: How many college kids can you cram into a single house ? That seems to be the theme with this vintage home in the Soo. We counted somewhere around 7 separate sleeping rooms on the second and third floor, and there may have been more in the basement before the interior hurricane came through. There is plenty of raw food garbage and discarded clothing and such here, as well as the obligatory doggie poo poo to clean up. The house has much character that could be restored if you're diligent. Coved plaster ceilings and some hardwood floors here. Most interior doors have been hacked up with locksets or padlocks. Structurally it is straight overall, with some decay and settling in areas, but not too advanced. Needs a cosmetic facelift as well as attention to the mechanicals, especially the electric. Lots of potential ... but plenty of work to go along with it ... Pet and/or wild animal waste was observed within this property. Potential bidders should consider that urine stains/odors can be difficult to remove from porous surfaces such as wood floors or underlayment.

10 Acres With A Rustic Shack On Sugar Island !

title: 40 Acres Near Bergland !!
comments: This is a "long 40", running 660' north-south, and 2640' east-west. It is located about 4.5 miles off M-64 on "Old 64" to the north. There are only a couple of homes on this entire road. A state trail comes across the SW corner of the land, and we have marked the approximate North and South lines along the road with red survey tape. The parcel is divided roughly in half by Old M-64. There is a real mix of age and variety in the timber here. This parcel is accessible by a road that is believed to be a seasonal or non-maintained public road. While we make no representations or warranties as to the precise nature of such road access, our research suggests that this road is either 1) Not regularly graded; and/or 2) Not snow plowed in winters; and/or 3) Appears subject to fallen trees or other events which have not been addressed by the county road commission. You should conduct your own research into this issue prior to bidding. Our visual inspection indicated that electrical service was not available on or near this parcel. The nearest electric service appeared to be a considerable distance (hundreds or perhaps thousands of feet) from the property. As such, electrifying this parcel could be costly. Please conduct your own research prior to bidding.

title: Lake Superior Waterfront Cottage !!!
comments: Here is what people are ALWAYS asking for. Lake Superior waterfrontage with a functioning cottage ! Property has 150' on Lake Superior. This is top notch sandy, sandy beach for thousands of feet in both directions. 12.52 acres total. While there are some things dated 2011 here, it appears that the last "regular" use was around 2003. There is no shower in the bathroom. We assume they improvised. The interior has a modest kitchen, 2 small bedrooms and a living room with wood burning fireplace. There is also a boathouse and a wood/coal fired sauna shed that also serves as extra storage. The electric service, probably original, is 60 amp fused. The majority of the land is situated across the street, and is deep marshland. However the cottage sits atop a gentle vegetated sand bluff and is level and dry. It is wooded exclusively in several varieties of pine and other evergreens. There are likely no "year round" neighbors out here, but several seem to be frequent seasonal or weekenders. Bottle gas only out here.

It appears to not affect the structural integrity of the floor however. The bathroom has been stripped down for an incomplete redo. The neighbor cut a tree doiwn in the rear and (so far) has left a brush pile to be cleaned up. The exterior could use new siding. Roof also is quite old. No signs of leaks ... but the magic word is "yet". title: Significant Historic Location At Painesdale. 9  Acres
comments: If walls could talk, this one could tell you the story of Copper Mining at Painesdale. This 9+ acre parcel is the warehouse for the Champion #4 mine, which sits across the street (not a part of this sale). There are two large, limestone buildings here, with the larger of the two being fairly ornate in design for a warehouse. The footprint of the two is roughly 150x60 (front) and 180x50 (rear). The two are connected and have several large overhead crane systems remaining from the "old days". The front building is very solid and shows little deterioration. The rear building is generally solid but could use some work on stone in places. The rear building has an addition to the far end that could be removed to bring the whole back to a unified appearance. There are two other metal buildings on the parcel, one is in poor condition. Neither are historically significant. The parcel is 9+ acres, much of which is a large slag pit and has no real functional use. There is roughly 4 acres of useful road-grade lands here. The site has 3 phase electrical service, however much of the wiring has been "harvested" for its copper value. We sold this property several years ago, and at that time it was fairly clean and secured. The present condition is quite messy. There are several thousand tires here as well as remnants of the last use, which was a metal scrapyard. The property is also subject to a lien by DEQ for past expenses in cleaning up contamination at the property. A purchaser will "inherit" this lien, which is well in excess of $150,000 as a part of the transaction. If you have sincerely interest in the details of this property, please consult with the Houghton County Treasurers office. This historic property has a TON of potential, but it will require deep pockets. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. This one started life as a single family home and was later modernized and split into a duplex on-the-cheap. The second floor has a really odd/poor flow as a separate unit. Basement access is from exterior rear. Dual electric services but only one furnace. No evidence of roof leaks. Seems to be generally solid but we noticed some sways in the floor upstairs that should be correctable. title: Updated 4 Square In Ironwood. Hoarder House.
comments: This is a classic 4 square on the north side of Ironwood. It was probably a very nice place, and has some terrific landscaping in the front yard. But it has become a hoarders haven and some the rooms are literally stacked nearly to the ceilings with second hand merchandise to the point that you can barely open the doors. It is very difficult to assess the condition of this house with everything inside, but it appears to be quite sound and straight. We saw no roof leaks. Vinyl sided. The main floor has been modernized, but the upper floor still retains much of the original trim. We could not get to the basement because of clutter to see what THAT is like, but we assume it is also loaded. Probably 3 30 yard dumpsters worth of accumulation here.

title: Wowzers !!! Super Cool Vacation Retreat Or Deer Camp With 28 Acres Near Lake Gogebic !!!
comments: This is sure to be one of the most popular parcels in the entire UP this year.<p> We have 28 acres that fronts on BOTH sides of M-28 between Bergland and Wakefield and is not far from Lake Gogebic.<p> The property WEST of the highway has large swaths of marshland and is great wildlife habitat.<p> On the WEST side of the highway, it is predominately wooded uplands. And a part of the "dry side" is a fabulous little LOG CABIN with a sauna and a metal storage building !<p> This camp is tucked well back into the woods and is very secluded and private. It is in outstanding "like new" condition. This is engineered log construction and EVEN YOUR WIFE would stay here. This place is ... seriously ... spotless. The power service is far forward ... toward the road on the front part of the lot. Check this one out in person. It is a fabulous little spot.

title: House With Potential At Anvil Location.
comments: This one started out as a symmetrical-design duplex. The most recent owner began the process of combining them into a single family home, but quit without completing the project. The front has a pretty decent persona, but it gets more dated and jagged as you move to the rear. Interior is stripped to studs in areas, and the mechanical systems are in disarray. This will take some work to finish, but it has "good bones" overall and is a nice, bright space with large windows. It has an "animal odor" to deal with, and will need general resurfacing. The mechanicals will probably all need upgrading, so plan that into your budget. Anvil Location. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. Property is located just NW of the NMU campus. About 1.25 acres here with 180.8 feet on Enterprise Drive. This is located in a mid-century industrial park area. The building is a Quonset hut-type metal building with a fenced side yard. Past uses here have included those types of things that could cause soil contamination, so we strong suggest that a purchaser obtain a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA) upon purchase, and may wish to consult with environmental professionals prior to bidding as well. The interior of the building is dirty, with lots of surface grime from oil and grease. There is a floor pit and several areas where it appears oils and solvents may have been introduced into drains and sinks. The rear yard, which is not paved, has 300 or so scrap tires and a large berm of soil that we're not sure the origin (or contents) of. There is an office area, as well as loft storage. The building has 200A 3-phase power service and municipal water and sewer. Natural gas here as well. We also noted a couple dozen 55 gallon steel drums of mixed labeling with unknown contents. The soils to the north side of the building are visibly affected with unknown substances that we presume are oil or solvent related. A visual inspection of this parcel indicates potential environmental contamination. Visual indicators can include things like used tires, dirty soils, or chemically intensive former uses such as dry cleaning. Prospective bidders should carefully research the condition of this property prior to bidding. You may with to contact the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality or other relevant state agencies for additional guidance. Purchasers are strongly advised to obtain a Baseline Environmental Assessment (BEA). Some basic information about BEA can be found here. All sales are made as/is where/is without any representations or warranties. It is the sole responsibility of the purchaser to identify and appropriately handle any environmental contamination that may exist. Please do all necessary research before the auction.

title: Rustic Camp Cabin On 2.87 Acres
comments: This is a solid mid-century cabin with a later addition, in Bay de Noc Township. The parcel is almost 3 acres in size and runs 500' along 15.25 Road, and 250' deep to the north. We did not see either insulation or any heat source here. The electric service has been upgraded to a more modern 100A panelboard. Steel roof that does not appear to leak. We did not locate a well, but we notice a water heater *and* large water jugs. There is a crude septic system that may not meet current code. Could be a really cute little place with the right finishing touches. The bones are good. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: Rustic Camp House On 2  Acre Parcel. Stonington
comments: Parcel fronts 150' on the west side of Stonington (Aa5) Road and runs 600' deep. There is an unfinished cottage here that appears to have been vacant the most part of 10 years or more, based on dated items found inside. It appears that the building had hot water heat, but the boiler is not to be found. The plumbing supply lines are mostly plastic, and mostly shattered from freeze damage. The electric service is in disarray and should be thoroughly checked before energizing. The home has one upper bedroom, plus a small loft. A small room on the main floor could be used as a second beroom of small office or den. The roof appears to be generally leak free. There is a gppd amount of debris to toss out. Please note that this parcel is directly across the street from sale # 403. Buy both and double the acreage ! 2 acres more or less. This property contains physical indications that one or more water lines have frozen, ruptured, and leaked for a significant period of time prior to being shut off. Such indications can include damage to ceilings and floors and visibly damaged pipes and fixtures. Damage from freeze bursts can be substantial including significant harm to structural components such as framing and foundations. The previous owner of this parcel undertook a construction or rehabilitation project which has not been completed. We have attempted to describe the degree to which the project has been finished, but the building should be be considered incomplete nonetheless. The local building code enforcement official may be able to offer additional insight as to why the project was never completed.

title: 150X600 Parcel With Trashy Mobile. Bay De Noc Township
comments: Parcel fronts 150' on the east side of Stonington Road and runs 600' deep. This is a nice parcel of land, but there is a bit of a mess to clean up. A stripped down, collapsing, trash filled mobile has been "stored" here. Much of the aluminum panel siding has been removed and it is in decay. It does not appear that it actually was ever "installed" here, and we do not see any evidence of well, septic or a power service ever existing. There is also a small pile of junk about 50' from the road. Please note that this parcel is directly across the street from sale # 404. Buy both and double the acreage ! 2 acres more or less.

title: Occupied Mobile In Bay De Noc Township.
comments: Older mobile is OCCUPIED. We believe that this mobile may be separately titled and may be removed. Parcel is a square acre, 208x208 and is located on a gravel dead end road. title: Building Will Be Demolished, Being Sold As A Vacant Lot
comments: Was a former duplex. Building is being removed. Being sold as a vacant lot.

title: Nice Acreage Parcel Near Chocolay Beach On M-28 !
comments: 7 acres here. Fronts 420' on M-28 beginning at a point directly across from Grosbeck Trail and running east to a point about where thewhite/orange gas line marker is located. Runs 750' deep. The topo maps do not indicate any marshlands on this parcel, but the presence of many cedar trees on this densely wooded parcel would suggest that there are moist soils here. There are numerous wetlands indicators at the road, including standing water and cat tails. Because of the dense growth, we did not get back into the parcel to see the conditions on the interior.

title: 40 Acres Of Hunting Land With Creek Frontage. Limestone Area.
comments: This is a "square 40", 1320x1320. Fronts on Mateacal Road and runs from the intersection of Cayer Road east to just past the culvert over Dexter Creek. Topo maps indicate this this is almost entirely marshlands. We saw no roads cut in to the parcel. Great hunt camp property with a little work. Power at the road

title: Harrison Home With Attached Garage
comments: Georgian Style Home for the early 20th century, Beautiful Stone Foundation. Home Looks to be Well built, with Layers of or decades of Modifications. The term "Good Bones" Best describes this home. Loads of Built-in and Charm, Several Bedrooms, 2 Bathrooms, Lots of wear, and Shotty building Techniques. Great Front Porch and even better Balcony. Mixed plumbing and Electric. Fantastic Sun porch, 2 car Driveway, Garage is a two car that converted to one car by blocking the door with a false wall. 3-tab Shingles, Basketball Hoop, Friendly Neighbor. Front Living room gooks to have had a large fireplace converted into an open storage area. Open Kitchen, 2 Breakfast Areas, Large Laundry with sliding glass door. Second Living room.

title: Cute Little Cottage In Harrison
comments: Looks to be an older home with a recent renovation, Newer roof and Siding, Forced Air Heat, Mature Trees, Adjacent to Rite Aide, 2 Bedroom 1 Bath, Solid Floors, Insulated Windows, Open Floor Plan, Basement, unfinished, Burst Water Heater. Charming Split Rail Fence, Up Graded Finishes, Missing Soffit, Dirty Floors, Will Require some Elbow Grease, but Worth it. Would Make a Fantastic Starter home or Rental Property.

title: Don't Judge A Book By It's Cover
comments: Older Single Wide Mobile Home on the outside, Trendy updated open floor plan on the inside. Large fence in the back yard, with wire, and insulated chicken coop perfect for raising your own Omelets! Party Shed on Side yard with Hinged Bar, Still unfinished. Home on the inside looks to have been Dry walled in most of the rooms, Floor leveled, New Twist Pile Style light colored carpet, Laminate Wood Look Floors on Kitchen and Back Hall, New Front Entry Door, 2 Bedrooms 2 Bathrooms, Master Bedroom features a Large Soaking Tub. Lots of Storage and Built-ins, Newer Pex Pipe and Wiring. Renovations look to have ben performed by a skilled laborer. Well Loved Home, with some additional simple finishes done by the right hand, This Mobile could make a fantastic starter home for a young couple who are looking for a budget friendly abode. However, some parcels also contain personal property such as cars, furniture, clothing, and other things which aren't physically attached to the land. Such personal property is not included as part of this sale. It is strongly suggested that the purchaser of this parcel contact the former owner and provide them the opportunity to remove this personal property before disposing of it. Minimum reasonable steps could include sending a letter by certified and first class mail to the former owner at their last known address. However, it is the responsibility of the winning bidder to determine what personal property is present on the parcel and the appropriate measures for handling such personal property.
