title: Former Inverness Daily Building.
comments: This sale is for PART of the old Inverness daily store building. The main portion of the building sits on this parcel, but a small part of the addition to the west sits over the property line and is still owned (technically) by the former owner of the dairy business. None of the other buildings here are a part of this sale ... it's mostly this building and the parking area to the front. Septic system location is uncertain ... and the well may be shared also. title: Former Cheboygan Co-Op Grain Elevator Building
comments: If you're looking for open, loft-type space, THIS IS IT. The former Cheboygan co-op grain elevator building is in generally solid condition. Most of the grain handling equipment remains, and the truck scale appears to be mostly intact as well. There are 2 floors with 10' ceilings that is solidly building in a traditional post and beam method. There is a substantial 3 phase electric service that is older but likely serviceable. The roof appears to have reasonably maintained, although there is a portion of the foundation along the north wall that is concerning. We could not view the basement because of standing water that exists because the power is off and the sump pumps are inoperable. (Welcome to Cheboygan). This building could make a fabulous flea market, artist cooperative or antique mall. Let your imagination loose on this one. It appears that the lot to the south is owned by the neighbor to the west. A visual inspection of this parcel indicates potential environmental contamination. title: Former Cheboygan Co-Op Storage Building Property.
comments: Front portion of building is 50x100 and in generally solid condition as a storage use building. The two sections are not connected inside the building. Rear section evidences roof failure and is is poor condition at present. There is a fenced and gated side yard that is roughly 70x150. The interior mid-section of the building is at loading dock height with a 10' ceiling height, while the front elevation is at grade. Electric service is a bit chewed up and will need attention. We saw no plumbing, insulation or heat. Cold storage. Needs some siding replaced. There has been some concern over potentiasl contamination here as fertilizers and other chemicals were stored here .... and other similar properties elsewhere have been found to be contaminated. title: Waterfront Site Condo Lot On Lake Gitchegumee !
comments: This is a WATERFRONT building site in a newer development at Lake Gitchegumee near Buckley .... about 15 miles south of Traverse City. This is a nice, level nicely wooded lot on a private gravel road. Construction here is subject to the restrictions of the master deed, and the purchaser assumes liability for association fees effective April 1, 2015. This parcel is part of a site condominium development. A condominium "unit" is a form of land ownership which is similar to a traditional subdivision "lot" but is also different in some important respects. Each condominium development is laid out in a document called the master deed which outlines the extent and nature of each condominium unit. The master deed also contains rules and restrictions related to construction and permitted use. Construction requirements can include everything from the size or design of buildings to color and orientation on the site. Condominium developments also include "common elements" like streets and sidewalks which are shared across all units. Some developments include amenities like golf courses, clubhouses, beaches, pools, and parks whereas others include only basic infrastructure like roads and sidewalks. Site condominiums also include association fees which can be significant. Prospective bidders should carefully review and understand the master deed and investigate association fees prior to bidding.

title: Square Acre Building Site Near Harrietta.
comments: A square acre, 208x208 on a poaved county road just west of Harrietta. Nice, level, open dry lands with a driveway and building site already cut in.

title: Swamp Lot Near Cadillac.
comments: Parcel sits south of the intersection of Fern Ave and Lilly Street. No road in to this lot. Topographical maps indicate that this is marshland. This parcel has surface water, soil, or vegetation conditions indicating that it may include wetland habitat. Such habitat may comprise all or part of the parcel's area. However, it is possible that this parcel contains buildable areas as well. There are many environmental and building regulations related to wetlands which you should consult before bidding on this parcel. It is your responsibility to determine if this parcel is suitable for your desired use. The roads which are shown on plat or tax maps for this parcel do not appear to exist or may be located in a different location than shown on such maps. While a legal right to build such roads may remain, this construction would likely be very expensive. However, in some instances these unimproved roads have been vacated or abandoned by action of the local government and no such right to construct the roads remains. Issues surrounding unimproved roads can be complicated and expensive to resolve. You should investigate the existence of any roads and the ability to access this parcel thoroughly before bidding.

Is in overall solid condition, with a minor skylight roof leak noted in the master bath. 2 BR 1.5 BA. There is an older travel trailer on the property that we do not have title to, so we are not selling that with the property. title: 10 Acres With A Modular Home In A Scenic Rural Setting.
comments: Newer modular home on a crawlspace. Sits high atop a hill overlooking a rolling wooded field and forest view. The modular has a few issues with the ceiling/roof at a bathroom skylight, and there is some loose and damaged vinyl siding. This appears to be a bank repo and has been vacant for close to 5 years. We found a couple of weak spots in the floor. Parcel fronts roughly 440' on the south side of E 26 Road. West line runs roughly 1320' deep. South line roughly 660' then north about 330' and north 990' to the road. This is a fractional section, so those dimensions are only approximate. Roughly 10 acres. Heavily rolling and about half wooded and half open. There is evidence posted which indicates that a lender may be attempting to foreclose upon this parcel after such parcel was foreclosed for delinquent property taxes. A purchaser may encounter future contact from this lender. Tax foreclosure supersedes the rights of mortgage holders. If a mortgage holder does not foreclose upon their mortgage interest prior to tax foreclosure, their right to do so is generally lost. Typically such mortgage holders were provided all necessary notice of tax foreclosure but failed to act in a timely fashion to preserve their interest. In rare instances it may be necessary to cancel a sale if a deficiency in notice to such a lender is discovered. Please contact us or ask questions at the sale if you have concerns about this issue.

title: Six Acres Offroad. South Branch Township
comments: Parcel has no direct road frontage, but appears to have easements rights across the lands to the south of it to reach 48 1/2 Road. Parcel is 363' east-west, and 720' north and south. Some nice oaks out here. Saw a couple nice sized deer. The access road in here is gated, so you'll have to walk in or find other access until you buy it and have the right to add your own padlock to the chain. We also see a two track that runs from the paved road along the east line of the lands here, but it is not clear if this is the easement road. You may want to research the location of the access road in records. Sign and red marker tape has been set at the SE corner of the parcel, and should be visible from the road. This parcel may be subject to utility, road, driveway right-of-way, or other easements which could allow third parties access to the property. Easements are not extinguished by tax foreclosure and foreclosed parcels are sold subject to these preexisting rights, if any. You should conduct your own investigation into the existence of any such easements prior to bidding.

title: Older Mobile In Cadillac
comments: Older mobile on a narrow lot on the northside of Cadillac. Someone put a lot of money and effort into rehabbing this one .... and took some of it with them when they left. The furnace, kitchen sink, toilet, sinks and every single light switch, receptacle and light fixture has been removed. The skirting is off in places, indicating that there may be missing copper tubing also. But it does have newer windows, and a roof that doesn't leak ... so it does have some potential. This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip.

Mid century tract housing on East Division Street in Cadillac. Has been used and abused. Someone took a hammer to the tile floors before they left, and it is overall pretty grubby. A thorough resurfacing could turn this into a nice little place though. Appears generally straight and solid, but will probably need a roof before long. There is a detached 1.5 car garage off an alley to the rear. Full basement has 2 finished rooms, but they're not legal "bedrooms" because of lack of windows. 3BR 1BA. Will need a new kitchen. Water supply piping is plastic and likely has freeze damage. 100A breakers. There is a low grade side shed at the wide door that probably should be removed. Bring your scrub brush and clean up !

title: Large Storage Building In Cadillac.
comments: One of the former light manufacturing buildings of the Mitchell Corporation, manufacturer of auto trim and interiors. Has an dual tractor trailer and a single box truck exterior loading dock. Two story office section and tens of thousands of square feet of open storage. This building has been stripped of much of its high amperage copper power wiring, but most of the panels, busways and conduit remain. The building is fully sprinklered for fire suppression, but there are heads removed in various locations indicating that it is in disrepair. It was heated with a large steam boiler, which remains but is in unknown condition. There are miles of steam lines and air compressor runs. The rear portion of the building is one story, and it appears it needs a new roof as there is pooled water in the largest warehouse room. It would require significant investment for this to become light manufacturing space again, and that may not pass muster with zoning. Its highest and best use is likely as cold storage or warehousing. We would suggest contact the local zoning officer to assure that your intended uses of the building are permissible.<p></p><p> PLEASE NOTE:</p><p> It is a REQUIREMENT of the office of the FIRE MARSHALL in the City of Cadillac, that the fire suppression (sprinkler) system in this building MUST BE IN OPERABLE CONDITION for any items to be stored in this building whatsoever. </p><p> The purchaser of this building will be required to post a $150,000 PERFORMANCE BOND in favor of the Wexford County Treasurer to assure that the fire suppression system is brought to operable condition; that roof repair or replacement is completed; and that the building pass local code enforcement inspections of all necessary types within 6 months of the sale.</p><p> Please contact the auction house or office of the County Treasurer for complete details on the performance bond to be furnished PRIOR to bidding. </p><p> Parties not furnishing evidence of commitment of a bond at the time of sale will not be issued a receipt or granted any right to enter for inspection. Any bond not executed and furnished within 20 days of the sale will be cause for a cancellation of the sale. </p> This parcel appears to have been subject to harvesting of electrical, plumbing, mechanical systems, or other building components. Buildings are sometimes targeted by criminals that steal or "harvest" items such as copper plumbing, wiring, furnaces, water heaters, fixtures, hardwood flooring, etc. This building should be considered incomplete due to such harvesting and may require substantial investment to reequip. A visual inspection indicated that this parcel may contain asbestos in the form of insulation on piping, boilers, or other structural components. However, no formal testing was conducted and the presence of asbestos has not be confirmed. There are other insulation products that are similar in appearance. According to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, asbestos is not likely to cause significant health risk when left undisturbed. See this EPA publication for additional information. It is the responsibility of the winning bidder to take proper safety precautions and conduct testing and/or removal efforts if deemed appropriate.
